course.subject: LANG
course.name: English for University Studies I
course.description: The course aims to develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in academic writing and their ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.
course.exclusions: IELTS - Band 7 or above in overall and Band 6.5 or above in each part of the test or equivalent

reviews.author: asd213kd
reviews.title: you must take this course, BUT YOU STILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO CHOOSE
reviews.comment_content:
Contents so far are not boring.

The first part is mainly about reflective learning, then with some critical thinking and speaking (discussion) in the next part, and finally with a speech (in video form).

Some are useful, but some are only wasting time. However, whether you like it or not, you need to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
VERY HIGH FREQUENCY OF EXTRA WORK.

During lesson, she will often ask us to walk out the classroom and record video or recording about peer evaluation. Peer evaluation is useful, but what it is required that interactions must be involved in the evaluation. With the high frequency that around two lesson there will be such a work in class or as after-class work, the problem is that we cannot find what can we interact soon.

Although we could still endure the embarrassment brought by the above problem, the teaching style of her was mainly following the activities from the notes on canvas, and adding some own activities. This is not a problem, but the problem is that these activities (and the peer evaluation activities mentioned above), were making up every minute of the class time. As a result, she only told us the deal date of the class, and without any further information. What we got were only information from canvas, and without any kind of information about how we can do better in these assessments. I heard that other classes will even teach how you can get better marks. So......when you still have choice, I strongly recommend you switch the tutor (if you find that you are in this class)
reviews.comment_grading:
The teaching is poor, BUT THE GRADING IS HORRENDOUS.

My grade is C+. I wonder if it was only me that got this wretched grade, but the fact was that most of the class was getting C+, and even C or C-. I strongly wonder if there exist a B with the fact that a top classmate was only having a B-. It was a horrible overall grading.
DO NOT HESITATE, SWAP NOW
reviews.comment_workload:
Just as what I have said in the teaching part, the workload is high, even with compared to other lang1002S classes. You might need to finish some extra video taking or recording. AND EVEN, the reflective diary task only requires you to write for 600 words in total, but she will ask you to write two 600 words' articles, and combine them into one by cutting words, which I had NEVER heard of the other classes doing this. And I mentioned, after we have done so much extra work, the grading did not reflect on what we have worked on.

If you don't want to have extra workload than normal lang1002S classes,
DO NOT HESITATE, SWAP NOW

U1L2 responsible language writing

Unit 2: developing language and literacy skills to help build effective arguments.

U2L2 Discussing alternative perspective (1)
U2L3 Discussing alternative perspective (2)
U2L4 Critical Reading
U2L5 Developing Strong argument

Unit 3: developing language and literacy skills to help communicate effective arguments for the audience and purpose.

reviews.author: chlkaren
reviews.title: Nice instructor and good grading!
reviews.comment_content:
- Two units from textbook
- Speaking task I (Upload video to canvas) -- 15%
- Writing tasks I (One paragraph about game changer) -- 10%
- Speaking task II (3.5-4mins talk about game changer) -- 20%
- Writing tasks II (An expository essay about game changer) -- 30%
- Vocabulary tests x2 -- 15%
- Participation -- 10%
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ka is probably from Hong Kong but with good British accent.
He's really a nice instructor as he took good care of each student. He explained things clearly like characteristics of academic writing.
He arranged time for us to finish assignments, which other instructors wouldn't. He also talked to us individually to know what topics we've chosen for the game changer essay.
Feel free to ask him questions, he's helpful and able to give you useful advice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was quite good and reasonable.
- Speaking tasks, I mostly got 5 but once got 6.
- Writing tasks, I got half 4, and half 5.
- Vocab tests :
  - 1st : 16.5/20
  - 2nd : 35.5/40
- Full marks for participation
Eventually I got an A- .
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload wasn't heavy but you ought to have good time management. The instructors usually give you sufficient time to accomplish the assignments. Yet, you'll have to revise for midterms and quizzes, so you should finish the essays ASAP.
As long as you actively participate in class and finish the library workshop quiz, you can easily attain full marks in participation.

reviews.author: ZhuKexin
reviews.title: nice teacher, good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Vocabulary

Understand and use a range of vocabulary and expressions that are commonly used in general English and in academic discussions.
Critical thinking and reading skills

Select, read and evaluate a variety of texts, including scholarly writing, to develop understanding of a complex topic.
Select appropriate information for a specific audience and purpose.
Distinguish key points from details in order to summarise information for a specific audience and purpose.
Writing skills

Plan, research and structure a piece of writing according to the needs of a specific reader and purpose.
Write a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs, in which topic sentences containing controlling ideas are expanded with details, examples and explanations.
Write a short, expository essay, using explanation, justification, description, and analysis.
Paraphrase sentences from sources to support ideas and claims; and appropriately acknowledge the sources.
Speaking skills

Speak about a topic for at least two minutes.
Make an oral summary.
Deliver a speech, inspiring possibility.
Deliver a documentary-style talk, using explanation and analysis to arouse the interest of your audience.
Pronounce sounds clearly and use rhythm appropriately

LANG1002 is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to raise your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence - e.g. thinking critically, discussing and presenting ideas logically - necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.

In this course you will develop your ability to use English to communicate appropriately and effectively. The thematic focus of the course provides context for tasks, most of which require small group collaboration and discussion. They are central to the course methodology. The course materials have been designed to present you with in-class challenges to your present language proficiency and communication skills, and the course assessment will help you to develop these further.

Both research and experience have indicated that the major academic language needs of students are in the areas of writing, speaking, vocabulary and extensive reading. The specific emphasis of LANG1002 is, therefore, on increasing your ability to:

write in a coherent, well-organised way;
speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts;
use a range of complex language, where appropriate to the task;
extract key information quickly from written texts;
take charge of your own language learning, particularly with respect to increasing your vocabulary.
The course is graded and carries three credits.

You may get started by clicking a link below.

reviews.author: reosaki
reviews.title: Meet the most handsome instructor for LANG1002S!
reviews.comment_content:
Related to grading:
2 vocabulary tests: We are supposed to memorize 120 words that are selected from the textbook. Not only the words themselves but also the derivatives of them are what you need to memorize. Vocab lists are provided in the test. Just complete the sentence with the required words.
Speaking tests: The first speaking test mainly focus on our ability to tell a story. You need to upload a 3.5-4min speech video. The second speaking test is closed to the Game Changer.
Writing Assessments: Two assessments are related. Unit 2 mainly tells you how to write an essay about a Game Changer.
Ivan also calculate the attendance and participation.

The overall aim of this class is fairly reasonable and considerate. You can really learn something from it, like public speaking, how to write an essay, etc. Though the structure required for the essay is kind of stupid and boring, your tutor will draw your attention to your logic and ways of expression.  This course particularly stresses the importance of citation. A library workshop is required and you need to complete a quiz after this workshop.
reviews.comment_teaching:
IVAN IS SO HANDSOME!
IVAN IS SO HANDSOME!
IVAN IS SO HANDSOME!

It is said that he is one of the few instructors who make PPT for the class. With great patience, he will give you detailed and logical analysis on your work. In his class, he not only teaches you English but also Cantonese, how to make up new words and drawing. Although serious on your attendance, there is no excuse for you to miss his class.  A really charming person XD.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ivan gave me an A-. Great surprise.
I've missed 2 classes and being caught chatting on Wechat at his class (I sit in next to his desk, bad choice :-(), and made obvious mistakes in the second speaking assessment... I thought he would give me something like B- or even lower...

Just focus on your assessments and be active in class. Pay attention to the class and fulfill the task that you ought to do.
reviews.comment_workload: It's better to plan ahead and make good use of time. Remember to accumulate the sources for your writing and speaking assessments. Putting off your work one to 2 days before the deadline or even less than 24 hours is really bad for your health and, of course, your grade.

reviews.title: Unexpectedly, not bad
reviews.comment_content:
Structure of academic writing as well as some general skills of giving a presentation will be taught.
Not quite useful but better than what we are forced to learn in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eunice is quite a good tutor.
Playing some videos during lessons and giving us time to discuss instead of presenting her PPT ceaselessly.
There are consultation of first reading and writing tasks, feedback will be given and you may ask questions.
She also does not ask us to waste time on unnecessary lesson.
I has asked many people for the information of this tutor but failed as she is new to teach LANG 1002S this year. Recommanded.
reviews.comment_grading:
Vocab test: 12.75/15 (so easy as all the words are given)
1st tasks: mainly 5
2nd tasks: mainly 6
Overall: A-
Quite unexpectly good grade (at least for this tutor), but I somehow also work hard like spending 8h on each task on average to check grammar and practice the speaking.
reviews.comment_workload:
80% attendance required.
If you simply want to finish the tasks, it is not time-consuming in comparison to MATH 1013 and PHYS 1112.
Spend more time if you want to get higher grade.

reviews.author: economist
reviews.title: Nick Wong - Grade-oriented tutor
reviews.comment_content: Just check others' comment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nick Wong will tell you what criteria will be accessed for grading. Therefore, follow his advice and marking guideline will help you much. I think he is as exam-oriented as the famous English tutor of Beacon like Kenneth Lau: focus on thinking strategies and skills. An excellent English!! Best English tutor I have ever seen
In the lesson, he will ask you to finish classwork in group which is closely related to the assignment.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A- though, in every task, I get 5/7. My class participation saves my life (10 Full I think) as Nick likes my learning attitude. Ask him questions about how to do better in normal assignment will help.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just like secondary school
Do some require assignment.
No extra homework for Nick Wong - GDDDDD

reviews.author: Tyy⭐️
reviews.title: She is not a killer！
reviews.comment_content:
I dont find it very useful. It is mainly about teaching speaking and writing skills.

I feel like I learn nothing when I finished my course, maybe I became more brave to speak in front of others, but them no more.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Linda gives you a lot of extra exercises and homeworks which she printed them by herself.

She is really a good prof passionate in teaching English. Although our attitude towards learning English is not active, she still
tried her best to offer help.

I didnt take ELPA and she recommended me to write a sample paper and booked an ILang advisor to seek for help. She calculate participation marks seriously and detaily through your attitude towards learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good I think, once you do good in one of the task, you can get a good grade.

Linda may look like a killer because she only gives 3 4 5 but very few 6. But the grade is arranged in her classes only. It will not be calculated with other lang1002s classes. That s why I got many 5 and only two 6 but still have an A-. For other class, students may get many 6 but them it cames out still a B-.

The grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Due to extra exercises from Linda...

reviews.author: Andy HK
reviews.comment_content: The content is a little bit boring and not very useful in improving our English.
reviews.comment_teaching: Colin is very responsible and nice. For instance, he replied to my email very quickly. He is also considerate because he let me leave earlier when i told him i was not feeling well that day.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is suitable. We have different types of assessment like 3 oral exams, 2 writing exams, vocabulary test.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy. Although the course is very tight and intensive because we have a three-hour lecture from Monday to Thursday, the assessment did not require plenty of time to prepare.

reviews.author: FiFiW
reviews.title: 幾好
reviews.comment_content:
Game changer

essay不做deadline fighter，時間和精力綽綽有餘。

還有Volt要做齊
有attendance， fall sem最多只可走兩次堂。
reviews.comment_teaching:
好人，會耐心解答問題
喜歡小組討論，不過很隨意。
會叫你回家看書看文章，回來又輪流一人一句讀一次XD
總之和中學差不多
reviews.comment_grading:
正常grade 同 好grade 之間啦

看你的造化  對比一些killer 那絕對好grade一點

reviews.author: KarenOu
reviews.comment_content: There are a lot discussion in the class and whether it is interesting or not depends on your classmates. One of the topic is game changer, and I like that because there are a lot of videos and great passages.
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is very nice and willing to answer your questions. She will talk about some interesting things she experienced in HK  in the class since she is Canadian.
reviews.comment_grading: There are two speaking tasks and two writing tasks plus vocabulary quizzes. It's easy to get a 6 out of 7 if you prepare well for them. Try to use what you learn in the class then she will give you good marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much, just a bit busy before every deadline for the task. I need to prepare two weeks before it. And just remember to do the vocabulary test on the volt.
And because I didn't get a good grade in the ELPA test, I often went to the iLang which she recommended a  lot.

reviews.author: Geungsi
reviews.comment_content: Mainly taught how to write an academic essay and how to give a speech, the skills are useful if u pay attention in classes
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching method is not boring, while won't waste time on useless things thus make every minites useful
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade he given out was mainly 4-5

I got a B+ so i think the grade is quite ok
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy workload, 2 speaking task and 2 writing task, VOLT
no extra hw after lesson

reviews.author: Hyung

加油啦

reviews.author: hayden tse
reviews.title: Grade取決於你本身嘅英文水平
reviews.comment_content:
9-10月中冇咩學，上堂係小組討論，傾下計咁
10月中-11月：如何寫學術文章，點做好個結構，點引用，演講嘅技巧等
reviews.comment_teaching: Anna教得幾好，份人又nice，學生訓覺都唔會嬲，不過英文堂無可避免會有d悶。
reviews.comment_grading:
走6 堂直接fail，走少過6堂點計就唔清楚
15%自拍演講
10%上堂寫一段學術文章（可以考之前寫好，但唔比帶稿入去)
30%寫一篇學術文章，要用番之前寫左果段
20%演講上面果篇文章，要將個tone由文章改做演講
5%網上用3個月時間學120個字，之後做vocab test，有18個test每個10題，全部都係揀字唔洗轉tense，人人嘅題目都一樣，所以可以揾人「幫手」
10%上堂做嘅vocab test，同上個嘅一樣，不過要轉tense，30分鐘40個字。
10%上堂表現分
本身英文勁嘅話唔就自然會高分，唔勁就要
聽說有d instructor 比分好手緊，有d就好手鬆
reviews.comment_workload:
9-10月冇咩做，得個自拍演講
11月就要做趕曬正得果d野，如果你本身英文勁嘅話就好輕鬆，我唔勁就份份功課都要做半日
Anna幾乎冇比過額外嘅功課，除左寫一封信比個friend，做下書上嘅題目咁(做唔做都唔點理)
聽講有d instructor會個個星期比功課

reviews.author: Tin Hei
reviews.comment_content: 要買本教科書 教下writing 教下speaking咁 同中學d 英文堂差唔多教寫essay同citation個陣都幾有用
reviews.comment_teaching: 廿個學生要圍住個instructor上堂 所以要專心上堂 冇得玩電話/訓教 不過Instructor都幾nice... 大致上係跟住本書嚟教 上堂好多時做gp discussion同presentation 間中會睇下片 上堂氣氛唔錯
reviews.comment_grading:
10% 1st speaking task (拍片3分鐘 關於story telling)
10% 1st writing task (寫一段百幾字paragraph)
30% 2nd writing task (600-800字essay past game changer)
20% 2nd speaking task (3.5-4分鐘 future game changer)
20% three vocab tests (第一次40 words 第二次 80 words 第三次 120 words)
10% participation (2次assignments, attitudes, library workshop, online quiz)

自己計過total score ~73%
-----> B grade
算合理
Intructor話成個lang 1002 course會調分 所以如果instructor就算俾得鬆手都有可能會拉低返個分
reviews.comment_workload: 視乎邊個instructor, 我個instructor差唔多堂堂都有功課要做(唔計分但唔做可能扣participation marks), 所以workload都有d大... 最chur都係2nd writing篇essay 雖然作600-800字但要搵好多資料又要做citation

reviews.author: duck
reviews.comment_content: major tasks are two speaking assessment and two writing assessment(will be graded), a lot of preparation for them. other learning resources. a learning plan should be made and will be graded.
reviews.comment_teaching: very good teaching style, a lot of time for discussion and presentation. sometimes dismisses class early if students have already finished the tasks
reviews.comment_grading: always very high and will explain why you are good or not, especially when error occurs.
reviews.comment_workload: home work every lesson, around 6 hours per week. but  most of the extra assignment from ta will not be checked.

reviews.author: JasperLi
reviews.title: Anna PS Yu
reviews.comment_content:
Quite good and 'seems' quite nice,overall is okay maybe.
But her grading style affects lots of people.
Although i think lang is useless but I am willing to take her class because it is relaxing and great (to me).
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think it is okay for me she makes the atmosphere great.
She tried lots of method to teach us English.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is uncertain,I heard some classes lots of people got c and some of them got D,some classes is okay ,I dont know
reviews.comment_workload: workload is okay and lang's workload is same as other tutor

reviews.author: NahNah
reviews.comment_content:
Boring.
Basic English knowledge for freshmen.

Usefulness: C+
Interestingness: C
Difficulty: B
reviews.comment_teaching:
The best teaching I have got so far.
He is funny and helpful.
I will still be in class at 9 o'clock for his teaching.
He encouraged us to share and discuss together. And that's how I met my new friends in year 1. Although the grade isn't that good, it worth.
I think my speaking has improved more than my writing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Several late submissions.
I put in the same effort as same as other courses. As you can see, my English isn't very good.
And I got C+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Annoying works.
There are almost small quizzes before every class.
However, it is a pain to complete the assignment.
Both short and long writing also included voice recordings.
Luckily, you can pick the formats in some assignments.

Conclusion: Don't forget the deadlines and don't procrastinate.

reviews.author: Ronale
reviews.title: Required course but choose your lecturer wisely
reviews.comment_content:
You will learn the most basic English requirement for university, such as writing language, reference list, grammar, and other basic stuff...

Apart from writing, some speaking and communication skills will be taught in lesson too.

There is no essay writing but some minor 400-words writings in this course.

If you know about referencing for essay and able to talk with foreigners, this course is wasting your time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Every lecturer are just following the same weekly syllabus.

Each lesson, there will be some required tasks to do, such as writing a short paragraph, record a video, or reflect on some readings. The lecturer might give you some advices on how to do it, but generally those advices are rather useless.

Depends on what lecturer you take, they might talk trash in lesson and slow down the overall teaching progress. This might make you to do extra work after lesson if the lecturer is not teaching efficiently. (Talk trash and not progressing the weekly syllabus)
reviews.comment_grading:
LANG1002 divided into 3 groups. From what I know, the ratio of A class people getting A range are definitely higher. Where S class people will only have the top few students getting A range.

Also, the final course grade is generated by the computer system, which is a ridiculous and kind of randomized system. There is no use in sending emails and complain about your final grade, they would just blame on the computer system.

Each lecturer's class tends to have a grade trend. My case, Anita Cheung's students tend to get lower grades even our coursework scores are higher than other classes. (I got a B- and my classmates got C range, other S classes could get A to B range, despite there are not much difference in our coursework scores.)

My advice, choose an experienced and generally well-known lecturer, their class might have better grades overall.
reviews.comment_workload:
As there is a weekly syllabus, there are tasks to complete for each lesson. However, most of these in-class tasks do not affect your final grade, not even a bit.

Only the online tasks and major assignment might affect your final grade.

At the end of every lesson, the lecturer might or might not remind you to complete those online tasks, so make sure to check it by yourself. If it passed the deadline, you cannot submit anymore.

Overall, this is one of the most annoying with heavy workload course, despite most of the things are useless at the first place.

reviews.author: KR
reviews.title: So-so
reviews.comment_content: The content may not be the things that you would have expected in university. Very few academic elements to be honest. There were lots of discussions in the classrooms and the instructors just tried to follow-up or expand on what we talked.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was fine. Just sometimes he may not have full control of the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Bad grades. I tried my best yet it didn’t come with my anticipated grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy, the SDLs were very time-consuming. The writings were also quite difficult as they required a lot of thinking and drafting.

reviews.author: Wall

Normal English teacher style
Fluent English and kind of native tone speaking.

慎重
Anisa爛龜到傻
SDL 6 3 over 7 7

reviews.author: fishandchips
reviews.title: Take IELTS and skip the course. Don't choose killers if you take.
reviews.comment_content: Three units prepare you to think, write and speak academically. Yet, just like the others, I don't learn much from the courses, unfortunately.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kin was obviously a passionate and responsible instructor.  He liked having interactions and discussions during classes by inviting everyone to share their thoughts or report their teamwork. If you have any questions that he can't answer at that moment, he won't ask you to leave them but will ask the course coordinators for more information and get back to you very soon.
reviews.comment_grading:
Self-directed learning tasks (15%, self-learned electives()
Discussion skills (20%, during consultations)
Reflective diary (25%, writing a 500-600 words essay)
Presenting alternative perspectives assessment (40%, a 3-4 minutes talking-head video and a 200-300 words summary)

It's not easy for students in S classes to get an A range, but it's pretty easy to get a B+.
Remember to attend as many lessons as you can and be (at least pretend to be) active in in-class discussions and responding to Kin's questions.
I got mostly 4 and 4.5 in every assessment which resulted in an A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is a lot more manageable compared to LANG1003. Just finish the tasks and submit them on time (and remember not to choose a killer), and then you'll be fine.
For the before class tasks, Kin would ask if we had completed them at the beginning of every lesson, but he seldom checked for our completion. Just do them if you have time and leave them if you don't.

reviews.author: blank
reviews.title: GOOD TEACHER
reviews.comment_content:
It's all same in Lang1002 courses.
It mainly focused on speaking and writing exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Humorous. Easy going.
Lots of in-class discussions.

Most of the time, he would not follow the lesson notes. XD
reviews.comment_grading:
Nick is a tough grader on CLE. (Compare to other teachers who give lots of 4~5)
But he is quite lenient to give a good grade at the end. According to Nick, around 6 people in the class will get an A range.

Writing related: 3.5 out of 5
Speaking related: 4 out of 5
SDL: full credit if you tried (regardless of the score)

Final grade: A (Big surprise)
reviews.comment_workload:
No need to prepare much other than the compulsory.
Around 20 minutes before the class

Just enjoy the lesson!

reviews.author: Stress and tens
reviews.title: Instructor: CHEN, Jasmine (Idk why I cant choose her name)
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 – Becoming a self-directed learner
Unit 2 – Building arguments
Unit 3 – Communicating arguments effectively

I don't think these things can help improve my English...
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is new to UST
Very nice, no pressure, willing to answer our enquiries, and asks us to treat her as our friends lol
reviews.comment_grading:
Self-directed learning coursework: 15%
Discussion skills coursework: 20%
Reflective diary: 25%
Presenting alternative perspective assessment (PAPA): 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
SDL: 1-2 short and easy quiz before each lesson; 2 electives (mainly grade on whether you complete them on time, not your marks on the quizzes)

Discussion: Assessed in-class, about social media (the topic is given before assessment, so can well prepare)

Reflective diary (*2): About being a student mentor and effective learning (there will be consultations with the instructor)

PAPA: Choose a debatable issue on your own, then write a summary and tape a talking-head video (there will be consultations with the instructor)

if u have level 4 in dse
,

reviews.author: Zachary260325
reviews.title: A nice chance to communicate and meet people
reviews.comment_content:
To be fair, the content is helpful in my English, especially speaking. And I got a glimpse into academic writing too.
This content may be really useful in my further studies, so I'll give it an A.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I really like the teaching method of my instructor, she has been to many places and she knows the ways of learning different languages. It really enjoyable taking her classes.
And as a student from mainland, this is a good chance to meet local students. It's really nice to know people from different culture backgrounds.
reviews.comment_grading:
Well, I thought I was hard working enough and I even spent a lot more time on this course than other courses, but it turns out I got A+ and A in all other courses and still got an A- in this course.
Although A- looks good enough, but I think it doesn't match the effort I put into this course. I asked my friends, and none of my friends got anything higher than A-.
This is why I gave an D to the grading, I don't like the grading strategies of this course. You could give everyone higher grades instead of giving everyone low grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is just ok for me. But some assignments take a lot of time to prepare and finish.
And as I want to finish the assignments well, they took a lot of time to finish the tasks.

reviews.author: KenLau
reviews.title: Ivan Yung is the best
reviews.comment_content:
Learn how to be an effective learner.
And learn about critical thinking, coherence, cohesion, analytical skills.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is a humorous lecturer who gives at least one joke in each lesson. Most of the lecturers don't prepare ppt, but Ivan does and he always plays music songs before the start of the lessons.
You won't be bored if you attend his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
SDL: 7/7, 3/3 (15%)
Group discussion: 3/5, 3.5/5 (20%)
Reflective diary: 4/5 (25%)
PAPA: 4.5/5, 3/5, 3.5/5 (40%)
overall: 77.33% A-
My frd gets 74% but finally gets B-
And one with 72% gets B.
They both attend different sections.
reviews.comment_workload:
We have to finish SDL before every lesson. You can get full marks for this part as long as you finish it.
1 writing (600words), a few group discussions, 1 talking head video (3-4mins), 1 summary (300words) in total
It is better not to skip any lessons.

reviews.author: 神奇寶貝
reviews.comment_content:
Topic:
Unit 1:  People, passion possibilities
Unit 2: Game changers
reviews.comment_teaching: She always encourages students to speak up during classes. She would frequently remind us to finish our assignment on time as well. During classes, students will be divided into different groups and assigned to breakout rooms randomly, which provided a great chance for us to make new friends :) .  (Tips: try to be the initiator of each discussion )
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good.
1st speaking task: 15% (upload recording)
Essay writing process: 15% (proposal + outline)
1st writing task: 30%
2nd speaking task: 20% (zoom presentation)
Vocab list*3: 20%
Try to answer questions when no one wants to answer.

My case:

Speaking Task 1:
2/4(Message, storytelling and organisation of ideas)
3/4 (Pronunciation and use of voice)

Reflections on Speaking Task 1: Pass

Writing task:
6/7(Essay content and use of sources)
5/7(Essay structure and paragraphing)
6/7(Language Use (especially academic style and use of cohesive devices)
+1(References Bonus Mark)

Essay Writing process:
4/4 (Attended the library workshop, completed the online quiz, essay topic proposal and outline
demonstrate commitment to the essay writing process)

Speaking Task 2:
5/7(Selection of content for an interesting informative talk)
5/7(Language Use (especially use of an appropriate style))
5/7(Pronunciation and use of voice)

Vocabulary learning records:
4/4

Btw, I never missed a single class.
End up: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload isn't huge.  But always remember to proofread your work before submitting :) .

reviews.author: Ged
reviews.title: Kathy is definitely a good instructor.
reviews.comment_content: English writing, speaking(presentation) and some simple tests(no ELPA this sem)
reviews.comment_teaching: Kathy looks cold and aggressive. However, if you really thought about what she told you, you would find her instructions are reasonable and helpful. In fact, she loves to give students instruction and advice, although she may look serious some time.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is fair cos you can check your essay grade, presentation grade on the CLE website. Compared to other instructors, I think Kathy is very kind to give students B+ even As.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. I don't know why other people say it is very heavy...

reviews.title: Best teacher ever
reviews.comment_content: so-so content. Secondary school stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very interesting class!! No homework!! Many casual discussion during the class, which you could make friends there.

He uses interesting examples to introduce different ideas. YOU WILL LEARN Somethings from his lessons.

正所謂 依啲lang 堂都一定唔會靚grade ，lang堂最緊要有趣。 㨂nick wong 實冇錯！ 佢啲切入點永遠都好帶動到氣氛，令你想認真學習英文！
reviews.comment_grading: fair grade. Grading depends on the grading scheme.
reviews.comment_workload: nearly zero workloads from its lessons, only the compulsory homework which requests from the department.

reviews.author: Ming Mak
reviews.title: Very nice and kind lecturer, but not very high grade
reviews.comment_content:
Intended Learning Outcomes
* understand and use words and phrases that are commonly used in these contexts;
* select, read and evaluate texts to develop understanding of a topic;
* use information from texts to support their own ideas in writing and speaking; and appropriately acknowledge their sources;
* write an expository essay containing a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs;
* deliver a speech to inspire;
* give a talk that is interesting as well as informative
* use features of connected speech to enhance the effectiveness of their speaking.

Quite good as the freedom is high to choose a Game Changer that you are interested, to do research on it other than assigned.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pionie is a nice, patient lecturer. She is very tolerate to student, though a little bit boring, but she is well prepared to class, very good time management and speaks clearly.
She is willing to answer questions in or after class, and you can chat with her as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair in grading, neither very good nor very bad.

For three vocab records, I got 2, 3, 3 respectively out of 3.
For the Game Changer speech, I got 5/4/4, out of 7.
For the Game Changer Essary, I got 6/6/5, out of 7.
I got a B finally.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite high, at least for me.

There are 40*3 vocabs you'll have to finish throughout the sem, like each 3 week once.
You'll have to detailly check the vocab, including collocation, P.O.S., etc.
Also, two speeches have to be completed, one is the Possibility Speech, another is of the Game Changer essay. along with one 800 word limit essay about a Game changer.

reviews.author: mc_cch
reviews.title: A nice instructor---- Rebecca
reviews.comment_content:
Almost the same for every year
LANG 1002 mainly focus on speaking & writing

Topic:
Unit 1:  People, passion possibilities
Unit 2: Game changers

You also need to complete a library quiz and attain a workshop, which were useful as we could learn to make citations in an essay.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I miss her so much ...  

Rebecca introduced herself and shared her teaching experiences with us in the 1st lesson. She is a scientist before, she used to write scientific essays and do some research in Chemistry. Later, she discovered her interest in linguistic and education, so she wanted to be an English teacher.

  Rebecca is passionate and patient, she would offer assistance to us when we have difficulties. Her engaging teaching style made us became more adapted to university life.


And she always said  'Today is a sunny day.....'   'How are you today?.... '
reviews.comment_grading: Shd be fair enough
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments:

Vocab record x 3
Speaking (Speech) x 2
Writing (Essay) x 1

If you are willing to follow her instructions, it is not difficult for you to submit the assignments on time.

reviews.author: Loner
reviews.title: Foundation of English studies. Rebecca is a nice instructor.
reviews.comment_content:
The course let students adapt to university English learning. It provides elementary academic skills, like writing essays and making presentations. The methods and steps taught in the course of writing essays do make sense in academic researches. It is a foundation, not that difficult but needs to pay attention to.

Including a library workshop with small quizzes, about looking up the resources of the essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rebecca is a good teacher. She always chatted with students before the class started. She likes roll-call students to answer questions. We usually were separated in breakout -rooms to have discussions, which sometimes led to cold fields. She would nicely make comments and annotate on students' assignments, which made it clear for students to know the good or unsatisfactory points in studying. She gave students personal consultation, which was useful, too. By the way, she deleted some things in the textbook when teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is including vocabulary learning, presentations, and essay-writing.

Speaking Task 1 - 3 3
Writing Task - 4 4 5 0
Essay Writing process - 3
Speaking Task 2 - 1 5 5
Vocab learning records - 2

There were some citation problems in my final-presentation task, so I just got 1 mark in the content part of the presentation. In the end, I got a C.
reviews.comment_workload:
Three vocabulary records, 40 words each time.

An assessed speaking task, recording a video aimed at telling to secondary school students.

Essay writing, with proposal and outline about one game-changer in the world.

Essay presentation.

reviews.author: MangGwan
reviews.title: difficult course
reviews.comment_content:
mainly about how to write in a better way if your English level is not really good like me, you might find this course is not very helpful as it does not teach you the grammar or usage, so just add oil because you must take this course


need to attend >80% (miss >6 class=fail)
if fail you need to take a winter sem course that has the same content
reviews.comment_teaching:
all online lesson (have to open cam)
Po lung is an easy going and passionate teacher
the lesson is quite relax
reviews.comment_grading:
my English is really bad so just a C+

1st Speaking Task       15%
Essay Writing Process 15% (you need to take a library lesson about citation and finish a quiz and the  process of the waiting task )
Writing Task          30%
2nd Speaking Task      20%
Vocabulary Learning   20%
reviews.comment_workload:
three vocab list (one chapter each, quite time consuming) take about 45 min each
one long essay (about a game changer, the )
one three min video presentation (about the possibility)
one four min presentation (about game changer)

the workload is quite high and if you want to have more time on other courses, try to work all the vocab list early as you can

reviews.author: ThreeSecondsccc
reviews.comment_content:
According to my experience,  the course materials on Canvas were barely used, but you can still read them to acquire some useful instructions for your essay writing.

Paying attention and be participating during the lessons were important since the instructor would teach you how to complete your assignments well.

However, I have heard that UST would have some change for year1 LANG course in the future(maybe next year? Can't remember.)
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is a good teacher. His lessons were interesting and also helpful for your assignments. Students will be divided into different groups to do some works regularly. By doing this, you can actually get to know your "LANG mate" and make some friends even it was online mode.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st speaking task: 15%
2nd speaking task:20%
1st writing task : 30%
vocabulary record*3 :20%
writing process: 15%

Again, paying attention and be participating during the lessons were important since you need to meet instructor's requirements.(i.e instructor would teach you how to complete your assignments well.)

Also, as this is 1002S, there would not have many A be given. If  you able to get A range in 1002S, you would be able to have 1003A for spring sem.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the workload is acceptable. It depends. If you really want to have good grade, you need to spend time on your essay and speaking task.

reviews.author: tthhh
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
1) video about inspirational speech + reviews
2)
writing task (outline)
writing task (completed)
3) speech (game changer)
4)vocab list
and do the VOLT online (you don't have to complete all of them but shows her that you have done some exercises)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teacher. Responsive! She always willing to help and she arranges consultation time for the writing task and speech.
She asked questions every lesson but the questions are easy.
And please do the discussion in your breakout room as marks will be deducted if she finds out that the room is silence but that's not a harsh requirement lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade!!!!!
Got an A- after attending all lessons and answer all her questions in class. I forgot my grade but I remember most of them are 5 to 6. My classmate is 2 marks higher than me and got an A. Just remember to submit all the assignment on time and very likely you would got a B+ or even A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload.
No need to prep before lessons and no homework for her lessons.
The videos and essay only takes me one day to finish them.

reviews.author: Kirin.K
reviews.comment_content: 基本上都係聽Nick吹水未必會學到好多嘢但係可以識下其他freshmen
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick Wong冇得頂 至少作為要計attendance嘅course會有動力去上堂
reviews.comment_grading: 靚grade嘅原因係因為Nick Wong 佢會喺堂上幫大家做曬啲功課 仲會改埋先交 即係個分其實都已經有佢幫手改咗先會計grade
reviews.comment_workload:
workload可以話係零因為所有功課佢都會喺堂上教一次 做一次 再改一次
有幾堂仲係專登改文 如果啲同學仔滿意 自己可以走

reviews.author: arianator
reviews.title: Doreen is very nice
reviews.comment_content:
Two topics, never change...
Possibility Mindset
Game Changer
Never change...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Doreen is nice, interactive and helpful. She always try to trigger our thinking and make the lessons more interesting. She will pick some students' name to answer questions when no one is answering her. Students who are enthusiastic can give her a good impression. So, introverts have to give lang course their all. Try to talk more and ask more questions.
Overall speaking, a standard good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is ok, reasonable. Not too good grade or bad grade.
1st speaking task: 15% (upload recording)
Essay writing process: 15% (proposal + outline)
1st writing task: 30%
2nd speaking task: 20% (zoom presentation)
Vocab list*3: 20%
Do your work with your heart and interact more with prof and classmates!

My case:

Speaking Task 1:
3/4(Message, storytelling and organisation of ideas)
3/4 (Pronunciation and use of voice)

Reflections on Speaking Task 1: Pass

Writing task:
6/7(Essay content and use of sources)
6/7(Essay structure and paragraphing)
5/7(Language Use (especially academic style and use of cohesive devices)
+1(References Bonus Mark)

Essay Writing process:
4/4 (Attended the library workshop, completed the online quiz, essay topic proposal and outline
demonstrate commitment to the essay writing process)

Speaking Task 2:
6/7(Selection of content for an interesting informative talk)
5/7(Language Use (especially use of an appropriate style))
5/7(Pronunciation and use of voice)

Vocab learning records:
4/4 (Completed all learning records well, providing significant evidence of vocabulary learning, such as clear definitions of the words and thoughtfully written example sentences)

End up: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much workload, its ok if you are not a deadline fighter.
Doreen will list her expectations and always remind you to hand in homework on time.

reviews.author: WWJWW
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches you to write an essay
e.g. how to write intro, summary

require you to join a library workshop to learn apa citations

most content is in the textbook but you don't really need the book to understand

following is direct copied from Intended Learning Outcomes:

* understand and use words and phrases that are commonly used in these contexts;

* select, read and evaluate texts to develop an understanding of a topic;

* use information from texts to support their own ideas in writing and speaking; and appropriately acknowledge their sources;

* write an expository essay containing a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs;

* deliver a speech to inspire;

* give a talk that is interesting as well as informative;

* use features of connected speech to enhance the effectiveness of their speaking.
reviews.comment_teaching:
instructor: Mark Melican
nice guy
he open breakout room in zoom for us to do group discussion, but usually no one talks. He discourages
this behaviour but he doesn't mind.

he also reminds us of some of the main points in the
reviews.comment_grading:
1st Speaking Task- 15%
2nd Speaking Task- 20%
Essay Writing Process(library workshop)- 15%
Writing Task- 30%
Vocabulary Learning-20%
reviews.comment_workload:
most workloads came from the 3 Vocabulary Learning list which has 40 words each
these list's workload depended on whose class you are in.
my friend's class is allowed to directly copy the example sentence from the dictionary but my class can not, I don't know if he will check it but I didn't risk it. He also emphasizes the sentence should
highlight the meaning of the word, so thinking sentences for some word is quite a pain

reviews.author: catman
reviews.title: LANG1002s
reviews.comment_content:
some techniques such as topic sentences, learn how to provide a good speech. Learning from the famous speech giver etc.
Learning 40 vocabs per vocab record, and you have to learn 3 records, which in total 120 vocabs.
reviews.comment_teaching: John is a nice and chill teacher. He is also polite and would try to solve and help us when we have problem.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got a B in my final grade. Almost all of the assignments (essay writing, both speaking tests) I got around 60-70%.
70% Attendance is needed and below 70% would result a F grade
Web cam is a must for Zoom meeting since there will be loads of group discussions.
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is a bit heavy in the sense that there are a lot of work but the work, compared to other courses, are easier.
such as the vocab record, most of the time you just have to go online and search for dictionaries, or synonyms, antonyms etc. It is really  time consuming but easy to be honest.
Have to write essay but before the essay writing, there will be guidance, such as constructing the outline of the essay, making proposal etc.
There will be 2 speaking test, 1 is recording and 1 is real time speech. For people who are shy might have a hard time.
There are also loads of group discussions so for introverts, good luck.

reviews.author: Gelsey
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1, People, Passion Possibilities
Unit 2, Game changers
Mostly speaking and writing skills
Many discussions in breakout rooms
reviews.comment_teaching: Passionate and helpful professor. You can always email him if you have any questions. He loves interacting with students. Try to be active in class so that he will remember you. He would enter breakout rooms whenever there's a discussion, and he would give us feedbacks, as well as make us talk in the main room to share our views after the discussions.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st speaking task 15%
Essay Writing Process 15%
Writing task 30%
2nd speaking task 20%
Vocab learning 20%
Full marks for 1st speaking task, writing process and vocab and mostly 5s & 6s for both writing task and 2nd speaking learning
Final grade A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Personally, I think that it's affordable. However, you have to really put effort into the vocab learning to score high. I take up at least 2-3 hrs for each vocab learning record (40 vocab). And remember  to start planning for your essays asap, esp on the research of the game changer.
Luckily, there are no exams.

reviews.author: dai0527
reviews.title: Nice Lecturer
reviews.comment_content:
兩個大單元：(i) Possibility Mindset (ii) Game Changer
少悶，吾洗太擔心catch up吾到，教嘅都係d basic concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Doreen係一個好nice嘅lecturer
雖然content少悶，但係佢都會盡量令課堂變得有趣。有咩問題佢都好樂意解答。
佢中意上堂嘅時候同學生有互動，即使系zoom佢都會叫人答問題。
reviews.comment_grading:
1st speaking task: 15% (upload recording)
Essay writing process: 15% (要寫proposal同outline)
1st writing task: 30%
2nd speaking task: 20% (zoom presentation)
Vocab list: 20% (total要交3次，每次40個)
P.S. 佢會堂堂take attendance
reviews.comment_workload:
吾算太大workload，都會比足夠時間去做，而Vocab list可以提早做。
同埋上堂嘅時候佢都會講自己對d assessment嘅要求，跟住做就可以。

reviews.author: chiuiun
reviews.comment_content:
I believe the content for each tutor was similar so I won't talk too much. I think his teaching suit for those moderate students, to strengthen some of your old knowledge.

My overall comment for Bruce: He is a nice teacher with kinda bad grades (cuz sometimes you may get downgraded, and you have to achieve more if you aim for A range.)
P.S. the grade/mark that he gave is the mean of the course so he is not really a killer.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Before my first lesson, I was worried that his accent was hard to follow and understand (from some reviews). But in fact, it was very familiar to me cause my secondary school teachers got the same LOL. If you are HKers, you don't need to worry.
He was enthusiastic to teach us new knowledge. He provided extra notes to us for further study. His teaching was straight-forward so you won't lost focus during lesson. Overall, he was a good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say fair marks, but definitely not a good grade.
Speaking 1: 8/8
Speaking 2: 15/21
Essay Preparation 3/4
Essay: 17/21 (including APA bonus mark)
Vocab: 4/4
If I remember correctly, this mark distribution is around 84%. The final grade is only B+ (my friend in 1002A got lower total marks but resulted in A). Bruce had said that his grade will be reviewed most of the time and I believed I was down-graded due to this reason.
My suggestion is that you should find another tutor if you can, since grade is the major concern for most of you.
reviews.comment_workload:
x3 vocab list with 40 new words each (Tips: you can add some synonyms for the new word to show your sincere lol, cuz not anyone can get 4/4 from the vocab list, and it's important to your mark)
x2 speaking test, one through recording and another one through zoom presentation. The latter accounts higher mark proportion.
x1 Essay for 800 words. The topic is about the past game changer.

The workload for this course is fine and reasonable.

reviews.author: Miracles
reviews.comment_content:
1. Practicing your oral skill
2. Practicing your writting skill and teaching you how to cite
3. Practicing your oral skill again
4. Vocabulary
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice lecturer with good teaching skills
She is good as she always give us choices whether we need to go through some of the boring stuffs, especially during the mid-term and before the exam period.

She always ask you questions in the lecture. It's fine if you answer it wrong or strangely as she will try to improve your answer and make it more accurate.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it's not that hard to get B range in this course. Although my English is quite bad, i still get a B+ in this course.

Maybe it depends on the lecturer.
So, I think you better participate in the lecture actively in this course to give a good reputation to your lecturer.
reviews.comment_workload:
Under online teaching mode:
1. Speech Recording
2. Short Essay
3. Giving Speech on Zoom
4. Vocabulary List x3

reviews.author: 馳名魚蛋粉
reviews.title: Fair Instructor and Fair Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Colin basically係跟住upload左上canvas嘅textbook content照讀 :)
所以上堂前預習下其實有啲幫助，起碼你可以好清楚Colin會問咩題目、你上堂個陣要做咩assignment等等，自己prep定上堂要講啲咩，等到Colin問出口個陣即刻衝出嚟搶答，衝到佢記得你個名為止:) 咁你就基本上firm實會靚grade
reviews.comment_teaching:
hea
一夠鐘就quit Zoom meeting
想問問題都問唔到，send email佢又唔會覆，上堂開mic問問題就會見到佢勁唔耐煩嘅樣，所以我都唔太敢煩佢 ;)
間鐘燥底，上堂個陣成日都因為有人答唔到佢問題就會黑面 (識做嘅就當然係等佢開始黑面個陣衝出嚟答問題刷下鞋咁，包你靚grade）
reviews.comment_grading:
Colin比嘅comment比左等於冇比，所以唔好太依賴佢比嘅comment，想要啲assignments高分嘅話就最好跟實佢比嘅instructions嚟做，咩assignments都做得aggressive啲，vocab都做得癲啲 (就算自己個分唔高都好:)咁樣做可以拉低下其他同學仔嘅分）
今個sem嘅Colin hea到冇人有
因為係online，所以以前要做嘅vocab test冇左
然後Colin淨係出左3份assignments嘅分

Speaking 1: 33 (6 out of 8)
Speaking 2: 556 (16 out of 21)
Essay: 555 (15 out of 22)

剩低嘅3份vocab record、reflection同essay proposal佢冇出到分，所以grading好迷

我overall grade係b
(PS 我上堂冇點衝過出嚟，所以個grade都算係咁）
(聽聞我呢個分數起其他instructor嘅班入面有a :) 所以Colin比grade都算緊，唔想爛grade嘅同學仔比科大pre reg到Colin記得趁早swap走佢）
reviews.comment_workload:
workload都算輕
Colin成日都延後啲deadline，只要你同佢賣下慘話呢排要考mid term或者final，佢就基本上會延後哂啲deadline

reviews.author: mickyli1117
reviews.comment_content: There are two main topics which are "Passion" and "Game changer". Not boring and more like "learning English through activcities"
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style is quite interactive, every student is involved and often be invited to share their thoughts. Even it is the online-teaching mode in this term, the learning atmosphere is still good.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% 1st Speaking Task
20% 2nd Speaking Task
15% Essay Planning
30% Essay
20% Vocabulary Record

For essay planning and vocabulary record, I would say it quite easy to get the highest grade. So you should rather put more effort into the essay and speaking task.
reviews.comment_workload: Soso

reviews.author: japholic
reviews.title: lang course= killer course
reviews.comment_content:
如果英文本身底差，讀完呢個course老實講係無幫助。
真心岩岩先上完，但係你問我讀左乜真係答你唔到... :-)) 浪費時間。
reviews.comment_teaching:
呢個tutor好chill,請過2次病假，遲入zoom又提早落堂，但係比分個陣手緊到喊。
你發電郵就預左佢一係唔答你，一係十年後先回復。Comments有比同無比係無分別:-))
reviews.comment_grading:
lang 窩，如無意外的killer course，身邊好多同學得C-range， 本人B-，守住B-range (cried)

D vocab record 無比comment :-))

聽聞讀lang係需要刷存在感，甘先有機會高分，睇埋其他review，好似話如果你幫手令到個氣氛好D會有加分。。。但係我個班好多NDS :-))撩佢地都5開口...
reviews.comment_workload:
有2個speaking assesments,做下peer evaluation,一份essay,3個vocab record。
有時上堂前要你做下功課。
無用又無謂，其實幾煩。

reviews.author: GPABaau4
reviews.title: Michael Tom
reviews.comment_content:
Paraphrase, speaking skills , writing skills.
Frankly pretty useless.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He taught us some basic English and I think that’s because students in our class are inactive and bad at English . He didn’t have much to teach.
He tried to fun but fail miserably.
I give him an A for teaching because we had a classmate called “Leo”. Constantly being annoying and asked irrelevant questions. And Michael’s way of treating him is gold. Funniest thing in his class.
reviews.comment_grading:
He graded based on people not performance.
If he doesn’t like you, you probably get something like 4/7 or 2/4
reviews.comment_workload: Just hand in everything on time. I never do extra homework that doesn’t count towards course grade. All you have to do is to make him like you.

reviews.author: Watermelon
reviews.comment_content:
‧ write in a coherent, well-organized way
‧ speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts
‧ use a range of complex language, where appropriate to the task
‧ extract key information quickly from written texts
‧ take charge of your own language learning, particularly to increasing your vocabulary.

main goal: speaking skills and essay writing
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is not bad. She would try to interact with you in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
speaking 1: 6/8
speaking 2: 16/21
writing: 12/21 + 1 bonus
writing process: 3/4
vocab: 4/4

Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Simply every week we have an assignment. For essay writing and speaking presentations, you might need to prepare them for a longer time. They are the heaviest workload in this course.

reviews.author: kkkkkkkkkkk
reviews.title: kind and good grade lecturer
reviews.comment_content:
Speaking skills (Speech)
-stress and pausing
-intonation

Academic essay
-content
-tone
-citation
-reference list
-choice of words
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eunice is a very kind and efficient lecturer. She will ask some questions in her lesson and encourage participation, meanwhile she always tell us that there is no pressure in answering her question, we can just share our own thought freely or even tell her that we don't know the answer if we do not know. She also prepared very well for lessons that all the main points and ideas are delivered clearly.

She always tell us the schedule of her class in advance and teach things in an efficient way so that we can have more time to prepare for our task and assignments. Unlike some other lecturer who finish teaching the important things right before the due date of the assignments. Besides, she usually let us go earlier whenever she have finish what she need to teach for that class.

Feel free to ask her questions at anytime whenever you found something confusing or unclear. I believe that Eunice will be happy to help you immediately. ( I have once send her an email and got her reply just after an hour!)
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade lecturer, I managed to get an A- even though I didn't participate very actively in class or get very high marks in my assignments.
First Speaking task 3 2
Second Speaking task 554
Writing task 5551
I thought that I would end up getting a B but I end up getting an A-, Thank you so much Eunice.
reviews.comment_workload: The tasks are manageable, they are not too difficult except for the academic essay, which takes me quite a lot of work.

reviews.author: enor2017
reviews.title: Grade is bad, as usual
reviews.comment_content:
There're lots of materials on Canvas and generally the lecturers should finish them one by one. However, Martha chose something interesting and important for us, which is more valuable and more helpful to our English learning, which I think is really good.

In a word, the official content is not satisfying, but what Martha chose is great.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Martha is a passionate and friendly teacher. She speaks a fluent English and is able to talk a lot about a certain topic in order to inspire us.

The highlight of her teaching is that she adds "2-minute talk" at the beginning of each class, during which we will be separated in pairs and make a 2-minute speech on a given topic to the other. I can say that this significantly enhance my ability to use English for communication and makes me not that shy as before.

In all, Martha is a really good teacher and I like her teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading:
As usual, LANG1002, 1003 don't have good grades. You don't need to be sad if you get a bad grade. The grades of these two courses have almost no relation with your efforts.

My grades:
1. Speaking tast 1:
- Message, storytelling and organisation of ideas: 4/4
- Pronunciation and use of voice: 4/4

2. Writing task:
- Essay content and use of sources: 4/7
- Essay structure and paragraphing: 4/7
- Language Use: 4/7
- Bonus mark for reference: 0/1

3. Essay Writing process: 4/4

4. Speaking Task 2:
- Selection of content: 6/7
- Language Use: 5/7
- Pronunciation and use of voice: 5/7

5. Vocab learning records: 4/4

Letter Grade : B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, it's adequate. From the grading scheme attached below you can see that you have relative long period of time to finish each of the assignments.

For the essay, the "essay writing process" helps a lot so that you won't feel difficult to complete the essay and no worry about selecting a wrong idea.

For the speeches, you need to prepare a script and try lots of times to ensure a good performance.

For word record, Martha made the matter simple. She just let us find words freely, and she won't mind at all if you just use the given wordlist. All we need to do is to copy the definition on the online dictionary and find an example with a topic that you like on google. This is really easy to finish and also interesting.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.comment_content:
he talked about nominalization & parallelism, summary & synthesis, Transitional phrases, comments on citation ...
it sound useful but i didn't pay much attention in lessons
spends most of his lesson for writing skills
reviews.comment_teaching:
Bruce has heart to teach
he always says he wanna teach us how he thought of the answers instead of giving us the answer
he doesn't use breakout rooms for discussion so often, for most of the time he giving his lesson and we listen. so you can daydream or use your phone under the cam
he likes writing more than speaking, so I think he give stricter grades for writing
reviews.comment_grading:
Unsure about his grading as I dunno how others was graded
1st speaking 3 3 (full marks 4 4)
Writing 4 4 4 (full marks 7 7 7)
2nd Speaking 5 5 5 (full marks 7 7 7)
Overall got a C+ only

He mentioned the grade will be reviewed by other people, if he gave us high grades it will be lowered. a similar concept with SBA in secondary school
reviews.comment_workload:
2 speaking Tasks
one is presented through video
the other one is presented in class
We need to give speaking review for the first speaking task

1 writing task about a game changing event
writing process also contributes to the final grades

3 Vocab list ( a waste of time)
Attendance

reviews.author: RIbtSU
reviews.title: The grade depends on whether the instructor likes you or not
reviews.comment_content: The content is good. Skills for speaking and academic writing were taught in the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: She will encourage students to speak more so there are several presentation tasks that were held in the lectures. The content is useful as she will teach us many writing and speaking skills. However, she always asked students she likes to answer the questions and gives a good grade to students she likes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is bad. No matter how much effort you put, the grade is still bad if she doesn't like you. There are guidelines for giving marks. But the guidelines are useless. She will only give a good grade to students she likes.

I put a lot of effort into doing the essay and the speaking assessment and use many skills she taught in the lessons, but the grade is still bad
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not large. The vocab list maybe a little bit annoying, but the workload is fair enough overall.

reviews.author: KACCC
reviews.comment_content: Quite interesting with many videos to give ideas of speaking, the content mostly used for enhancing our assignments' performance.
reviews.comment_teaching: Many communications betweens students with groups. We can try to exchange ideas about our speeches/essays.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is okay, however, its quite hard to select your ideal class/instructors in 1002s(as it usually full), some teacher give higher while some lower, the vocabulary list carries 20%(for 3 submissions), but grading criteria is large(0/1/2/3/4 only), when you get a 3, meaning there is 5% loss in your full marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Due to online teaching, The vocabulary list (40 vocabs/ 3 submissions)is quite a time consuming(around 3-4 hours each). However, there is no choice ;).
Other assignments are simple, an 600-800words essay, 2 speeches with 3/4 mins respectively, the second speech can use the content of the essay, which saves plenty of work.
No MT/Exam!

reviews.author: 日修運動服愛好者
reviews.title: A tutor who encourages you to speak
reviews.comment_content:
Divided into 2 themes
1.Possibility
2.Game-Changer
reviews.comment_teaching:
Every Lesson, Martha would have a 2 minute talk on students, the topic is related to our everyday life so that we can improve our speaking efficiency.(Last lesson before 2nd speaking task is 3 minutes)

She won't like other teachers only focus on the textbook content, sometimes she would share her own experience to students.

Also, she would have discussions on every lesson, and present our thoughts to the whole class(Related to the lesson)

She reply to the emails very quickly that you can get advice from her for the course
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite fair, she is not a killer at all
1st speaking task(Possibility) 22 w reflections
Essay writing process 3
Essay(Game Changer) 454+0(Reference Bonus)
Vocab Record(3 times) 4
2nd speaking task(Game Changer) 444
reviews.comment_workload:
If you want to get good grades, you should do more practice on the two speaking tasks(I didn't prepare well for 1st speaking task, but improved in 2nd speaking task) and listen to the comments given by classmate for every 2 minute talk

For the Vocab record, you should better search for website examples for example sentences, not just rely on the sentence given by the dictionary.

For the game changer essay, you should do more pre-writing work on finding information and post-writing work after you have finished writing the essay.

reviews.author: vic116_ip
reviews.comment_content: LANG1002 is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to raise your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence - e.g. thinking critically, discussing and presenting ideas logically - necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.
reviews.comment_teaching: interactive teaching, nice and talkative teacher, fantastic learning atmosphere
reviews.comment_grading: grading is quite good. i completed all tasks, attended sightly above the minimum number of lessons, actively participated in classes (before online learning), and finally got a-.

participation

reviews.author: Ching_
reviews.title: It’s fair
reviews.comment_content: Using the textbook materials and ppt, nothing special. Some class discussions in lecture. Some assignments after class but you can choose whether to finish it or not. It is just up to you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fair, he willing to provide advice for the assignments. A nice tutor.
reviews.comment_grading: Kind of good. I mainly got 5 and only some 6, and have my vocab test just passed, but finally got A-
reviews.comment_workload: I guess all lang course have a similar workload. In this course, there are 2 speaking tasks and 1 writing task, and 2 vocab test (1 is cancelled this semester).

reviews.author: Garrick
reviews.title: Be a Bootlicker to get a nice grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is mainly about writing an academic essay. The course instructor will guide you to write one of the body paragraphs in the writing assignment 1. And the second speaking assessment is mainly making some little changes to the essay and read it aloud to the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually, Fiona is a pretty good instructor, I enjoyed her course quite well. She does maintain a good learning environment in the class, so I think most of our classmate enjoyed the class. However, I have not done any research before, so I don't know she is a killer or not. But if you can leave a positive impression to the instructor, I don't think the grade would be too poor like me.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st Speaking Task       15%
1st Writing Task           10%
2nd Writing Task          30%
2nd Speaking Task      20%
Vocabulary Learning   15%
Participation                10%


The grading of the course is quite subjective. Since I got an average of 4 out of 7 for most of the tasks, which is an averaging score. However, I got a C+ for the final grade. Maybe I have a poor impression. My friend shared a similar score from most of the assignments with me, but he got B for the final grade, and he is also in S class. I think the grade is relatively related to your impression in the instructor's mind. So the key to achieving good grade from this course is to be a bootlicker and maintain a good relationship with your instructor.
reviews.comment_workload: There are in total 2 Writing Assignments and 2 Speaking Assignment. The second writing assignment is an academic essay. If you are not a deadline-fighter, the workload is reasonable. The speaking task may need a lot of "takes" of recording. It depends on your pronunciation and fluency.

reviews.author: jefferyma
reviews.title: I love Fiona!!!
reviews.comment_content:
1. possibilities mindset
2. game changer

The topic is quite normal and not so interesting but I think that it's some speaking and writing skills they taught that helped me a lot? Some examples and tips in the textbook are quite useful in writing essays and speeches.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I don't know why I can't find my instructor in ust space and can't add one myself. BUT, my instructor is really good! She organised the class quite well and some activities are interesting while helpful. For instance, she would let us discuss some topics in a group and write a small speech. She would then give us a poker and people who got a specific card would go up and make the speech. it's quite scary at first but it did help me! Another activities like vocab games and practice our speech are entertaining as well! she is also very patient with us and answered questions clearly. Though I though she was a killer at first (sorry), she isn't! Love her!!!

BTW, her name is Ho Fiona and I hear that she also teaches LABU!

Anyway, a good instructor!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty good! Totally out of my expectations!
Everyone keeps saying that 1002 is bad, however, I think it really depends on the instructor. I actually got a bad score in speaking assignment 1 but managed to get a relatively high score in the rest of the assignment. Got A finally. One of my classmates even got A+ so I think it's not that bad.

my result:

speaking 1:  5 5  (out of 7)
writing 1: 7 6  (out of 7)
writing 2: 7 7 6  (out of 7)
speaking 2: 6 6 5 (out of 7)
vocab 1: 19
vocab 2: cancelled
attendance: 3 (out of 4)
reviews.comment_workload:
Depends on your attitude?
I spent a lot of time in refining my essay and finally got a good score. However, you can just write a draft and hand it in but maybe not a good score.
Speaking the same.

BTW, vocabulary test is hard!!! Prepare for it in advance!

- 1st assessed writing task (10%)

所以最好唔好上堂玩手機/ 訓覺/ 做啲令個tutor嫌棄你嘅事...乖乖地就無事啦lol

reviews.author: bri_
reviews.comment_content: Based on the Lang textbook but there’re also many related interesting content added Like some short video
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmel is really good at leading us to think more and deeper about a topic. U can learn not only how to view a question  but also get some novel insight to the problem.
Many discussion, brainstorming and little group task in class. Interactive and fun
reviews.comment_grading:
Do as instructed and spend some time to prepare and review, u can get good mark.
Grading is fair and nice
reviews.comment_workload:
2 vocabulary test. The words are not that difficult, spend some time and u will pass
Writing task about game changer. Need some extra reading to find reference, best choose topic u are familiar with. Carmel will tell u what’s ur problem and give some suggestions individually before u start to write the final version.
Oral presentation, upload video. Remember prepare more before deadline. Though u can retake a video if u forget ur script but it’s time taking to video many times.

reviews.author: 美要眇兮
reviews.title: A best-ever teacher ever met!
reviews.comment_content:
1002s has all very similar contents, which I think is not very appealing, maybe worth only a C+ or so.
The first chapter is about people, passion possibilities.
The second is about game-changers. (Which is the emphasis of such course.)
In each chapter students are required to do some brainstorming, analyze certain examples through reading and group work, and exchange ideas with partners.
However, Carmel is so interesting a teacher that she makes the topic discussion procedure more interesting and abundent. You can tell that she has done a lot of work on related topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good! She is always trying to lead the discussion to a certain direction, helping us to think deeper and deeper and with more various perspectives. She tried her best to help everyone have the opportunity to speak without too much pressure. Also, her focus is always clear and precise, as we can always get the core of passages or the lesson given. Her course is pretty abundent in content, since we can also read some extra parts of a story, watch an extract of a speech, or share our own life stories with the class. We can know the knowledge required through work in class, and her course is both beneficial and interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair and great!
Carmel always gives instructions of assignments and following the instructions is quite helpful. She also hold private talks with us to discuss how we can accomplish the tasks better and how we can learn English in an appropriate way, which is very nice!

Grading scheme:
10% participation
15% vocab test*2 (5%+10%)
15% 1st speaking task (deliver a speech to your high school juniors)
10% 1st writing task (a paragraph about game-changer)
30% 2nd writing task (an essay about game-changer)
20% 2nd speaking task (talk about the game-changer in an oral way)

My:
Speaking:
1st: 7,7
2nd: 5,6,5

Writing:
1st: 3,5 (actually I didn't think enough before I started so there are some logic mistakes which block the way of understanding)
2nd: 7,7,6 (+0)

Vocab test 1: 18/20
(test 2 cancelled this term)

Since Carmel helped us a lot in the way of facillitating our capability that connect with these assignments, getting a 5+ in each assignments becomes easier to achieve.

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Actually close to 0 extra workload other than preparation of the word test and fulfillment of necessary assignments.
Necessary work: 2 vocab tests, 2 speeches (recorded) (2min, 3min), a part of an essay (beginning) and the whole essay.
Since I come to know that some course instructors gave a lot of after-class reading and task-fulfilling and even make them memorize more words than the vocab test list, I think this class is quite light.
I actually didn't pay much attention and I work on LANG1002s for about 20h in total.

reviews.author: billyso0103
reviews.comment_content: The course focuses on formal writing and speech. all content is focused on the topic"game-changer" where you need to set a topic on a specific game changer and write an exploratory essay and do a speech on your game changer
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is excellent. Shaun is a nice teacher with huge passion and adequate knowledge. He tried hard to maintain a good and active learning atmosphere during class.
reviews.comment_grading:
need to be active in class and pay attention to every assessment because the grading is base on the weighted score of the assessment

speaking task: 5 4
writing task 1: 6 6

overall: A-
reviews.comment_workload: Mild. Include a short writing, a long writing(essay), 2 vocab tests and 2 speeches. It could be quite heavy you aim for an A, especially mesmerizing the vocal and diuing the essay.

reviews.comment_content: 2 speaking plus one writing about game changer

reviews.comment_grading:
not too bad if you try to response more in class
I do quite gd in vocab which is 18/20
and first writing almost all 5
but second one just two 5 and others 4
outcome b-
reviews.comment_workload: no workload at all lol, he won't give you any outside class assignment, so if you want to hea in the lang 1002 class, he is a great tutor.

reviews.author: freehongkong
reviews.title: Choose Ivan and no regret
reviews.comment_content:
English course for year 1 students in the fall term.
There are 2 units for the semester.
Unit 1: People, passion and possibilities
Unit 2: Game changer

Tasks and units are related.
1st speaking task: Inspiring possibilities in younger students (2mins)
2nd speaking task: Introduce a game-changer. (3mins)
1st writing task: A short introduction of a Game-changer (120 words)
2nd writing task: Game-changer essay (800 words)
reviews.comment_teaching: Ivan creates funny atmosphere for the class. He plays music and chats with us at the start of every lesson. You will not fall asleep as his lesson is awesome compared with other boring lectures. He makes PPTs for the topics which are easy to follow. Choose Ivan and no regret!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Very Good grading.
2nd vocab test was cancelled due to suspension of the term.
Every task are graded from grade 1 to 7 in different areas (vocab, grammar, content etc.)
A few 6s, average 5 for all tasks
Vocab test 17/20
Turns out A-

Course assessment scheme:
1st Vocab test + 2nd Vocab test 15%
1st Speaking task 15% (video-taped)
1st Writing Task 10%
2nd Writing Task 30%
2nd Speaking Task 20% (In-class)
Participation 10%

Attendance
You can do make up-task to erase your absent record in case you will miss the next lesson. A warning letter after missing 3 lessons and fail for missing 6 lessons.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload compared to some other instructors who give tasks every class. Ivan only gives the component tasks which fulfil the course assessment. Just participate in the discussions and answer the questions he asks frequently in the class.

For the assignments, of cuz you need to write scripts for speaking tasks. But since the content of 2nd speaking task and 2 writing tasks are similar, you only need to change the essay into a speech. Therefore the workload for tasks is not heavy at all.

reviews.author: gdhdsv
reviews.comment_content: The textbook contains most of the contents which are decent, typical information for non-native English speaker, separated by different topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A friendly and serene instructor.
The lessons are relaxing. I felt no stress in it.
It is probably so far the most comfortable course in my year 1 life.
Class activities included mainly watching video clips and group discussions, which we seldom pay attention to.
reviews.comment_grading:
speaking 4445
writing 5556
one vocabulary quiz 18
