reviews.author: cwl.Alex
reviews.comment_content:
The course is a compulsory course for all first-year students. S stands for standard, this course is for DSEers with 3/4 in English.

The book is pretty useless, costing about $300, yet only using it for about 5 to 6 lessons. Our instructors put all the resources needed online (canvas website). You don't need the book for the homework. Marking schemes are provided with the homework file or on canvas.

You are expected to attend all the classes provided.
In this term, you are allowed to skip for a maximum of 5 lessons. However, you can do some self-learning to waive your absence (even I've never tried so).

The two themes this semester: Possibility Mindset and Game Changer

To be honest, the skills taught in the official scheme are basic and you don't have to worry about catching up the classes IF your instructor is teaching according to the book.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr. Douglas gave us easy and relaxing lessons. He paid attention not on our academic results, but our interest in English. Sadly, he will not be teaching in UST anymore.

On the other hand, Ms. Lam trained us on our speaking and the context of our speech. We also had online video lessons. She mainly trained our tone and pronunciation.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of Mr. Douglas is easier, he will easily give you a 5 out of 7 or more in tasks.
Ms. Lam is more harsh to us, 4 would be for the average students. The scoring is tight.

The scale is something like this :
first speaking 10%
first writing 10%
second writing 30%
second speaking 20%
vocabulary quiz 10%
participation 10%
As 2nd vocab test is canceled, the 10% scoring rate is spread to the 2nd writing, 2nd speaking and the participation marks.

Having almost all 5 marks and 3 to 4 4 marks, I received a B+, while my friend got a B- for more 4s than 5s.
reviews.comment_workload:
Officially, You will need to have:
2 pieces of writing
1 video presentation
1 live presentation (changed to video presentation this term)
2 vocabulary tests (one canceled)

Tasks are linked all together. The first writing is linked with the Library lesson (it is called LIBA2019 and you need to book for the lesson), and the second writing is linked to the 1st writing. So you need to do your best starting from the first task possible.

Vocabs are provided in the tests, so don't worry too much as long as you can remember the meanings of the vocabulary.

But out of that, the workload depends on your instructor(s). Mine wouldn't give us extra HW beyond the content, but I heard that some classes would have weekly tests or more stuff to do.

reviews.author: 神月 godmoon
reviews.title: IELTS
reviews.comment_content:
Related to grading:
2 vocabulary tests: We are supposed to memorize 120 words that are selected from the textbook. Not only the words themselves but also the derivatives of them are what you need to memorize. Vocab lists are provided in the test. Just complete the sentence with the required words.
Speaking tests: The first speaking test mainly focus on our ability to tell a story. You need to upload a 3.5-4min speech video. The second speaking test is closed to the Game Changer.
Writing Assessments: Two assessments are related. Unit 2 mainly tells you how to write an essay about a Game Changer.
Ivan also calculate the attendance and participation.

The overall aim of this class is fairly reasonable and considerate. You can really learn something from it, like public speaking, how to write an essay, etc. Though the structure required for the essay is kind of stupid and boring, your tutor will draw your attention to your logic and ways of expression.  This course particularly stresses the importance of citation. A library workshop is required and you need to complete a quiz after this workshop.

reviews.author: Oscarlol
reviews.title: Rebecca is so nice!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
LANG1002 is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to raise your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence - e.g. thinking critically, discussing and presenting ideas logically - necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.

On this course you will develop your ability to use English to communicate appropriately and effectively. The thematic focus of the course provides context for tasks, most of which require small group collaboration and discussion. They are central to the course methodology. The course materials have been designed to present you with in-class challenges to your present language proficiency and communication skills, and the course assessment will help you to develop these further.

Both research and experience have indicated that the major academic language needs of students are in the areas of writing, speaking, vocabulary and extensive reading. The specific emphasis of LANG1002 is, therefore, on increasing your ability to:

write in a coherent, well-organized way;
speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts;
use a range of complex language, where appropriate to the task;
extract key information quickly from written texts;
take charge of your own language learning, particularly with respect to increasing your vocabulary.
The course is graded and carries three credits.

reviews.author: Richard Fan
reviews.title: Tag唔到>Thomas Anthony Chun Hun CHAN
reviews.comment_content:
2 vocab test:
第一個40字中考20字，第二個120字中考40字 (呢個test嘅時間係上一個嘅double)
2 speaking test:
第一個 upload video(3.5-4min)講一個自己嘅故事去證明你突破困局 /有能力去做到一啲野, 第二個係堂上分享一個game changer.
2 writing test:
第一個係寫一段 paragraph 關於你個 game changer, 第二個係將段 paragraph 抬展，寫一篇文關於你個 game changer。
reviews.comment_teaching:
平時一上堂就會開始timed talking。佢會由一開始嘅1分鐘，之後慢慢每一堂增加15秒，去到最後嘅2分半鐘。係timed talking裏面會俾2條題目, 2個人一組，輪流講，其實係幾好玩，因為我地講個陣都係係度吹水，有時講廣東話俾佢發現, 佢都淨係會提醒下我地講返英文。討論完之後佢會抽人出黎分享自己/partner 講過嘅嘢。
完左之後，佢就會對住 powerpoint講書上面嘅內容，間唔中先會叫4人一組討論然後分享。

佢係第一次writing test 之後會每人分一段時間（約 10分鐘) ，係堂上面同你傾你份文，因為係一對一面談，所以個個禮拜另外一堂唔駛上。

Accent 其實幾好聽，但係都會有少少香港嘅口音。

因為課程內容關係，佢教書都會跟返syllabus, 唔會講好多額外野，所以亦都好少講個人嘅經驗。佢冇 overrun 嘅情況發生，反而有試過因為已經教完書而早放。我覺得佢係一個好 tutor。

reviews.author: Knight
reviews.comment_content:
LANG 1002 is a task-based course with topics taught (Inspiring possibilities & Game changers).
The course mainly teaches you how to write essays in an academic style, how to use citation and how to improve your speaking by using skills like stresses and pauses.

Honestly the content is boring, so it is very important that whether the tutor can create a good learning environment and atmosphere in class.

Attendance is required, and if you skip 6 or more lessons you will get an F immediately, so don't skip classes if possible.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rosita is an enthusiastic tutor as she prepares PPTs for teaching and encourage classmates to speak more in discussions by asking inspiring questions.

She remind us of the deadlines of assignments in her PPTs too, so she is quite caring and thoughtful in my opinion.

She also reminds students many important skills improving writing and speaking skills.

She is also helpful and she always tries her best to answer our questions and clarify all unclear details.
reviews.comment_grading:
I originally thought that she is a killer because she did not give really good marks in those speaking and writing tasks, but the final grade really surprises me a lot.

Speaking Task 1: 4,4
Writing Task 1: 6,5
Writing Task 2: 5,6,6,1(Bonus for correct citation)
Speaking Task 2: 4,4,4
Vocab Test 1: 15.5/20
Vocab Test 2: 35.5/40
Participation Mark Unknown
Final Grade: A-

Thanks to Rosita for giving me such a really good grade!
Actually I think that my performance is not really outstanding as the full mark is 7 for each criterion, but it seems that my performance is above average in my class so I get a pretty good grade at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say that the workload is not too light but not too heavy. You definitely need to spend some time on your assignments in fact, and I believe the more time you spent on preparing, checking and proofreading, the better results you will get.

If you really want to perform well and get a good grade in LANG 1002, you need to work harder e.g. read more English articles and books, speak English more and do those out-of-class work if possible.

So if you want to get a good grade in this subject please do not register her classes. If you don't mind to get a C+ ( like most of the classmates in her class) then go ahead.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload for her class is quite heavy. She will give some unofficial assignments for you to finish that on google docs. If you do not do it, your participation marks will be deduced and in average there are one unofficial assignment per lecture.

Inspiration
Game changer

reviews.comment_workload:
The assessed tasks are
1.Record your own speech ( 2 1/2 - 3 mins)
You have to be inspiring.
2. Write one paragraph
You gotta fulfil one of the three questions given
3. Write an essay, like 5 paragraph
1 intro, the 3 questions, 1 ending
4. Speech( in class). Make good use of your 5 paragraph essay, cut and sew . just choose one question to mention in your speech,  it will be 3.5-4 mins.

Ah. And don't forget to att. library workshop.
AND word tests
you don't need to memorise all words given but it will be a must for you to at least know what's that word's meaning.
They would require you to change forms, like adding s and making into -ing sth like that.

reviews.author: CelinaC
reviews.comment_content:
成個課程既主軸係Game Changer，包括一d介紹game changer既文章同短片，老實講對比起中學既課程有趣左。建議買textbook，如果唔係就要堂堂問人借，我見幾多tutor都係堂堂用書，Doreen更加係成本都有講。
有小小reading assignment，一般都係一段至到一版，而且唔讀都完全ok，上堂主要都係討論，每堂隨機分組，比你同唔同人傾下計咁，只要你係講英文，講咩都冇乜所謂。
拍既video題目係你作為大學生想比你以前中學師弟妹既建議同鼓勵。
essay同present就係簡一個game changer黎介紹。
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen既課堂真係令你明白咩係學英文而唔係考英文，佢會講一d東方同西方語言系統之間既有趣小分別，我個人對呢d小知識比較有興趣，會令我覺得上堂終於唔係只為分數，所以幾鍾意呢種teaching。
reviews.comment_grading: Doreen係鼓勵性既tutor，只要佢見到你有心想學，而且符合佢既要求，就算唔係表現出彩都已經可以好高分。
reviews.comment_workload:
我覺得好睇tutor會唔會比extra野你做，聽過有tutor當補習班咁，堂堂返去就為左兩份計分assignment操卷咁操，但我個tutor就冇。
如果齋講course比分既幾份功課，其實workload唔多，個speaking video可以一日內搞掂，writing會先叫你寫一段裡睇下，佢比左comment之後再跟住寫其他兩段，oral presentation既內容同你篇essay完全一樣，你只要搵人講d內容刪減下，排成你想講既順序就ok。
總體黎講唯一要寫既其實只有essay，而且會好循序漸進咁教你做，所以我覺得完全可以接受。

reviews.author: halo123
reviews.comment_content:
You have the chance to practice English in class but don't expect to learn a lot in this course cause I think the content is less demanding than due English.
Two units
Unit 1: People, passion, possibilities
(Week 5) 1st Vocab Test: 40 words, 20 fill-in-the-blanks questions, words list provided 5 %
(Week 6) 1st Speaking Task: 2.5 - 3 minutes speech to inspire possibility 15%
Unit 2: Game changers
(Week 8) 1st Writing Task: a paragraph about a game changer 10%
(Week 11) 2nd Writing Task: An essay about game changer 30 %
(Week 12) 2nd Vocab Test: 120 words, 40 fill-in-the-blanks questions, words list provided 10 %

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: A Language class which your classmates and tutor decide your fate/grade
reviews.comment_content: I find the content didn't change for years so just refer to the previous feedback.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Doreen, I would say just a normal tutor.
She follows the textbook which I find not too useful. Sometimes she prepares extra powerpoints addressing the key notes of different tasks and different ways of effective writing and speaking.

In class discussions are essential for each class and she requires us to finish the in-class task together and exchanging ideas.

As she is a Canadian, she shows her interest finding out the difference of various language backgrounds in class and try to adjust our pronunciation and word stress.

I would say everything is just normal.
reviews.comment_grading:
Her grading and marking is relatively strict compared to other tutors of this course.

She gives one 4 and mostly 5 for all of my writing tasks and first speaking task. I only get a 6 and two 5 for my second speaking task.

I perform very normal for my vocabulary tests and participate normally in the class and finish all the requirements on time.

Normally she gives 4 or 5 for most students and just if you perform well she gives 6 but never 7.


THE KEY THING I WOULD LIKE TO ADDRESS IS THAT CHECK OUT YOUR CLASSMATES DURING ADD-DROP PERIOD AND THE PERFORMANCE OF YOUR TUTOR.

I WAS SO REGRETFUL THAT I WAS IN A NIGHTMARE IN THIS CLASS, FACING A NORMAL TUTOR BUT ANNOYING AND STRANGE CLASSMATES WHICH DEPRIVE YOUR CHANCE TO SPEAK IN CLASS. So your classmates judge your grade. I would say please find some friends together to attend the class to secure class discipline and performance.
reviews.comment_workload:
The Workload for LANG 1002 is probably quite heavy for students studying the first semester.

Vocabulary Test
Two tests on Week 5 (20Qs) and Week 12 (40Qs)
Testing first 40/ all 120 words from the vocabulary list
Need to check out the meaning and the different part of speech of the vocabularies in order to fill in the blanks correctly.

First speaking assessed task
A video-taped speech talking about inspiring possibilities for secondary students who are looking for university study. (about 3 minutes) Need an attractive opening and structured speech, with key messages delivered to inspire possibility.

First writing assessed task
A paragraph( about 150 words) talking about a game-changing idea. Aim at writing a concise paragraph in an academic way.

Second Writing assessed task
The toughest task of the course. An essay with 600-800 words mentioning a game-changer, answering three questions,
1. why it is a game changer
2. The conditions making it to be a game-changer
3. The impacts brought by the game-changer
Require the use of adequate sources and academic wordings, as well as to write in a logical and structured manner. Quite difficult and heavy. Need to hand in at the end of Week 11.

Second speaking assessed task
Talk about the game changer you have written for the writing task, a in-class speech spending around four minutes. Try to speak in a casual and catchy way, with the use of attention grabber and hooks, and deliver your ideas clearly and fluently.

Attendance and Participation Mark
I think you just need to attend all classes and give some useful responses to the class to get the basic marks. This also helps inspire your tutor.

HOWEVER MOST IMPORTANTLY, YOUR CLASSMATES MAY RUIN YOUR GRADE AND YOUR MARK.

Be aware that some STRANGERS and PEOPLE TALKING TOO MUCH BUT NOT EFFECTIVELY CONTRIBUTING TO NORMAL DISCUSSIONS  in the class may affect your overall feeling and expectations for the course, as well as influencing your in-class and out of class performance.

Library Workshop
Just go ahead look at the ways of citations and finish the quiz.

reviews.author: Goco
reviews.title: Your grades depends on your INSTRUCTORS
reviews.comment_content:
Vocabulary
-Understand and use a range of vocabulary and expressions that are commonly used in general English and in academic contexts.

Critical thinking and reading skills
-Select, read and evaluate a variety of texts, including scholarly writing, to develop understanding of a complex topic.
-Select appropriate information for a specific audience and purpose.
-Distinguish key points from details in order to summarise information for a specific audience and purpose.

Writing skills
-Plan, research and structure a piece of writing according to the needs of a specific reader and purpose.
-Write a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs, in which topic sentences containing controlling ideas are expanded with details, examples and explanations.
-Write a short, expository essay, using explanation, justification, description, and analysis.
-Paraphrase sentences from sources to support ideas and claims; and appropriately acknowledge the sources.

Speaking skills
-Speak about a topic for at least two minutes.
-Make an oral summary.
-Deliver a speech, inspiring possibility.
-Deliver a documentary-style talk, using explanation and analysis to arouse the interest of your audience.
-Pronounce sounds clearly and use rhythm appropriately

reviews.comment_teaching:
I would like to express my gratitude here for Eunice's kind teaching. I really did learn a lot and I enjoyed every single lesson. :)

She is a passionate tutor and she always spends time preparing extra materials for us. (she likes to tell us the exact time she prepared lol) The activities she prepared is enjoyable and useful meanwhile. For example, group writing, story telling with peer evaluation, video viewing and many more... Sometimes, she told us some of her own personal experience which is relevant to the topic. Most of them are quite interesting and funny.

She tend to be very efficient, she cover all the points that is important then she will let us leave. Although not following the textbook strictly, she did cover all the important points with a good logical flow. In fact, I want the lesson to be longer because I really did learn things......

Sorry for this lengthy review but I have to give credits that she put effort in giving us feedback. She gives out lots of chance to practice our speaking and writing skills in class, and she did give comments and suggestions to most of them. Before the 2nd speaking task, she even held a (optional) practice session to give us detailed personal feedback on part of our speech. She also gives useful suggestion for improving our English (like shadowing, find a speaker and try to speak like him/her). I seriously thought I have never learnt English in my secondary school......

110% recommended.  Sadly she won't teach LANG 1003 next semester. :C

reviews.author: hjk215
reviews.title: The most "hea" teacher that i have met in my life
reviews.comment_content: Mainly just follows the book and read them out. Then why i have to attend lessons, I could just read them at home. If it was not for the attendance taking, i would not have taken even one lesson of his. A complete waste of my time. Two assessed writing and speaking tasks which he doesn't even teach about and just told us to look at the marking scheme and the guidelines on canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching: Again, just literally reading out from the textbook and play videos that are in the common resources of canvas. Does not seem to care a bit for the students. Coming in the classroom 5 minutes late and letting us leave 15 minutes early is the usual practice for every class. Like he doesn't even bother to teach. A classmate even said that he doesn't reply to his email regarding the writing assessment. Like seriously?He didn't teach us at all on how to complete our assessed tasks, just simply told us to refer back to the guidelines and marking scheme. Then what is his purpose? I haven't met a teacher that "hea" throughout my life and he really broadens my horizons and redefines "hea".
reviews.comment_grading: I am not quite sure about his grading methods cause it is completely irrational and doesn't seem to grade along with your aptitude. It is almost like you are in a mark six and the first two balls that you roll is your grade. For the first writing assessment, he gives 2 and 3 in two domains with 7 and 7 as full marks. What??? 2 and 3? I am not illiterate! While other teachers are giving 6s and 7s for homework that was done on the day of submission, I was getting 2 and 3 for a homework that i drill on for 2 days. Wow! When I ask him why i got this marks, he simply replies that cause according to the marking scheme, I think you deserve this mark without any further explanation. And when me and my classmates compared our work, we find out that the assignment that was done with minimum effort gets the highest mark. So good luck if you are enrolled in his class, expect to have low grades and expect that your marks are not proportional to your aptitude. I am expecting a C with his "excellent" grading. By the way, the normal grading for these kinds of tasks are 5 for normal people and 6 and 7 for smart ones. My friend who get level 3 in English managed to get 5s and 6s for all tasks with a different tutor. For grade's sake, swap to another tutor. But if you just want to "hea", then he is the perfect tutor for you.
reviews.comment_workload: Totally 4 assessed tasks of extremely poor grading from our great non-subjective tutor. 2 speaking tasks, 2 writing tasks and two vocab tests in total. Expect getting 3s and 4s so you won't be surprised when you receive your marks. And perhaps study for vocab test, as it is the only assessment that can be judged without bias, although it won't affect much since the majority of the grade comes from the writing and speaking assessed tasks. Got 34/40 for vocab test but got 2 and 3 out of two 7s in assessed tasks shows you how objective the grading is. Please swap to other tutors if you are that unlucky to have him teaching for your 1002S class.

reviews.author: Benman
reviews.comment_content:
LANG1002 is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first-year students.
The course aims to develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in academic writing and their ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.

reviews.author: chpoonag
reviews.comment_content:
- 2 vocabulary test:
40 words for the first one, 120 words for the next one. The 120 words include those in the first test. In the real test, those items are provided. You have to change the word form when necessary. So, you had better remember how to spell the words in other word forms.

- 2 writing assignments (Topic: Game Changer):
Or it should be 1 instead as the first one is just the first body paragraph of the essay of the 2nd assignment. It is about a game changer. Evidences are required. You need to cite the source you used in the essay in APA style, which you will learn during class and a library workshop.

- 2 Speaking test:
The first one is about telling a story and the message, which is about 3.5 - 4 minutes. The speech is recorded by yourself and uploaded to canvas. On the other hand, the 2nd one is about a game changer you chose to write about in the writing tasks. It is similar to the 1st speaking task except doing it in class in front of the others, and it will be recorded.

ELPA is not included in this course. ELPA taken in Aug, which is called a 'pre-test', will not be graded.

This course is a common core course required to be taken in the first year. You will be pre-registered to I, S, or A stream according to your English proficiency.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Yuen would give comments on your work if you asked him. Try to remember those comments and prevent similar mistakes in the upcoming tasks. Should you do so, you may get a higher mark more likely.

If you want to learn more about English, never rely on the course. During class, what you will learn is just about dealing with those tasks. Therefore, extra effort outside classes may be necessary for the sake of the ELPA test in subsequent LANG 1003 course. That test accounts for 40% of the final grade of LANG 1003.

reviews.author: sjjtchen
reviews.title: Nice and considerable instructor
reviews.comment_content:
All the LANG1002 classes share the same content. The  topics are passion and game changer. Some basic speaking and writing skills are taught.
I have to mention that the content is boring, but unfortunately we have to take this course without satisfactory IELTS or TOEFL scores (SO try to get one before!)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many useful tips for assignments are told in an acceptable speed.
The instructor is really helpful and kind. He gives lots of help during my preparations for the assignments. Don't swap if you are in his class.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very fair and the instructor is not a killer. Although he seldom give 7 on your assignments, if you prepare well, an A range is definitely possible.
My English is not so well and only get an average of 4 in ELPA, but I got A- in the course, which is out of my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very much workload. As the second, third and fourth assignments are continuous, you can prepare for them at the same time.
The instructor doesn't ask for extra work to get participation marks. If you attend all the classes, it will not be hard to get full marks in participation.

reviews.author: Ayang
reviews.title: Nice and beautiful Instructor!
reviews.comment_content:
In class, the instructor well focus on discussing and make students know each other well. She taught us thing like academic writing, citation and presentation skills. Content is easy and most of it is to help you with your assessed tasks.
  But I think LANG1002S course is not interesting and not sooo helpful......
reviews.comment_teaching: She is really really really nice!!! She patiently answered our questions. She gave every student time and explain where to improve and how to make progress next time based on his own assessed task. And she is very fair.
reviews.comment_grading:
Many students say that LANG1002S is a bad grade course. But it really depends on instructors and I think this year's grading is quite okay in many classes.
  You don't need to compare your scores with other instructors' classes. You can ask your classmates for comparison but it isn't a good behavior......
  Rosita's grading is very fair. If you want to score high, you should behave actively in class, submit tasks on time and be punctual.
  The assessed speaking (1) 54
  The assessed writing task (1) 54
  The assessed writing task (2) 4561 (1 for bonus)
  The assessed speaking task (2) 654
  Two vocabulary 16.5/20  32.5/40
  Participation 4 (I didn't miss any classes)
  Finally got A-
  The ins didn't give high scores in tasks to her students. But I have to say my vocabulary is not that good. You had better do the VOLT and I think quizzes on canvas should be done.
reviews.comment_workload:

Video about inspiring possibility and opportunity something like that.
Essays: Game changer (short paragraph and long essay)
120-word vocabulary test x2
  Presentation of game changer you choose

reviews.author: Jacky Mok
reviews.title: If you are still in her class after add/drop period, good luck
reviews.comment_content:
Two units
Unit 1: People, passion, possibilities
(Week 5) 1st Vocab Test: 40 words, 20 fill-in-the-blanks questions, words list provided 5 %
(Week 6) 1st Speaking Task: 2.5 - 3 minutes speech to inspire possibility 15%
Unit 2: Game changers
(Week 8) 1st Writing Task: a paragraph about a game changer 10%
(Week 11) 2nd Writing Task: An essay about game changer 30 %
(Week 12) 2nd Vocab Test: 120 words, 40 fill-in-the-blanks questions, words list provided 10 %
(Week 12/13) 2nd Speaking Task: 3.5 - 4 minutes talk about game changer 20%

Participation + library workshop 10%
reviews.comment_teaching:
Extremely boring.
Every lesson: Read textbook, do the activities printed on textbook, check answers
I learnt nothing after a semester. As you can see, my English is still poor.
She took attendance secretly during lesson.
She could not remember student's name, even on the last lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st Vocab Test: 18/20
1st Speaking Task: 4/7 + 4/7
1st Writing Task: 3/7 + 4/7
2nd Writing Task: 4/7 + 5/7 + 4/7 + 0/1
2nd Vocab Test: 33.5/40
2nd Speaking Task: 3/7 + 4/7 + 4/7
Participation 3/4 (I never asked a question in class. End up with same score with a langmate who ask question and answer question every lesson)
Library workshop attended
Final grade: B
Much better than I expected. I guess it's because i did well in vocab tests.
reviews.comment_workload:
As i said, she could not remember your name. You do not have to do the homework that she assigned. Just remember to do the assessment.
Remember not to spend too much time on the assessment. You will only get 4-5 / 7 anyway. Spend your time on vocab.
No need to ask questions during class to show that you are very active and focused in class. Simply because she cannot remember you.

reviews.author: VP
reviews.comment_content:
There are 2 speaking assignments and 2 writing assignments.

The first speaking task was about 'passion' and inspiring people and the audience of the speech was secondary students. We only had to make a video and hand it in online so no need to worry about speaking in front of the class.

The writing tasks was about writing a game changer. We had to answer 3 questions related to the game changer and include citation in the essay.

And the last speaking task was to present your game changer to the class. We had to prepare a 3 minutes speech talking about the game changer that we wrote in the previous essay. Mr. Wong allowed us to take note card but it is better to practice more beforehand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr. Wong is a very nice instructor! He understand that we would be so sleepy (because it was a 9am class) so he always use different ways to try to wake us up like he encourages drawing mind maps and group discussions in class. And he let us to have breakfast in class:D
reviews.comment_grading: I was surprised that I got an A range because I thought 1002S usually do not have any 'A's. But I think the grade is all depends on the instructor. Some of my friends have similar marks but they got a lower grade because of harsher instructors.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine. I spent around two afternoons on each assignment. Apart from the speaking and writing assignments, there are also two vocabulary quizzes. The vocabulary list will be provided before and it is easy so no need to worry if you put enough time to revise. The quiz is to fill in the blanks using the vocabulary in the list.

Second task is to write a paragraph of Game Changer. There are word limit, no more than certain words.

The third task is to writing the whole essay base on previous paragraphs. Not difficult but u need to finish it early so u can ask for opinions from your instructor.

The last assignment is to give a speech base on what you’ve written on your essay. You can choose just one paragraph or more and present it as a speech.

Those assignments are not time consuming because instructor will give you weeks to finish each one of them.

reviews.author: charlottecut
reviews.title: Your efforts will pay off.
reviews.comment_content:
The structure of this course is composed of 3 parts: vocabulary quiz, assignments and participation.

For the vocab quiz, actually there are 2 quizzes and you have to memorize 3 vocab lists (120 words in total). In the quiz, words are provided but you might have to change the word form.

For the assignments, the 1st speaking task requires the student to talk about inspiring others and you just have to hand it in by video format. Then the other 3 assignments: 2 writing tasks and the last speaking tasks are related, which is the game changer.

For the participation, let the teacher remember your name and you can score better.
reviews.comment_teaching: I'm impressed with his accent and his preparation. He would prepare his own powerpoint slides for teaching. He would analyze the example essay with us in which it is totally useful for us to work on the assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
1st speaking task 10%
1st writing task 10%
2nd writing task 30%
2nd speaking task 20%
vocabulary quiz 20%
participation 10%

He gives me 6s for both speaking tasks and 5s for the writing one. Though I failed one of the quizzes, I got A- for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Compulsory assignments for this course only, no extra work is given by the teacher, so no worries;)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Linda is a decent instructor.
She will help you through out the assignments, having Q&A sections during tutorials to clear up misconceptions.
She usually organize small groups of 3 and ask us question, which in turns giving us more interaction in class.

However, since the course needs to finish the book at the end of the semester, the schedule is tight. Be prepare! Often you finished your assignment, somethings that you need to do in your assignment to make it better, is revealed during the day before, or even the day of the deadline!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was unexpectedly good.
With reference to this forum, scoring a majority of 5s and a bit 4s, the best scenario is a B, but what came out was a B+!
The grading seems to be more lenient this year, as Linda has sometimes emphasize that getting straight 4s = C-, straight 5s = B-, through out her classes, which seems to be true for past years.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course is heavily based on your English proficiency.
If you do not excel in English like me, the course is demanding.
The assignments that I had done, have been revised many many times, just to get a 5 at the end.

Linda is one of the instructors that will give out extra work after class, but she will not scold you, if you have not done you homework.

reviews.comment_teaching:

reviews.comment_grading:
1st Speaking Task (15%)
-A 2½ – 3 minute speech to inspire possibility in younger students
-Week 6
-Video to be uploaded to CANVAS on or before Friday

1st Writing Task (10%)
-A paragraph about a past game-changing idea, in which you demonstrate your paragraph writing skills.
-Week 8
-To be submitted to your instructor by Friday 27th October

2nd Writing Task (30%)
-An expository essay, in which you introduce a past game-changing idea and explain its impact. The essay must be submitted to Turnitin.
-Week 11
-Final copy must be uploaded to Turnitin

2nd Speaking Task (20%)
-A 3½ – 4 minute talk about your past game changer.
-Weeks 12 & 13 (in class)

Participation (10%)
-The extent to which you demonstrate a mature and responsible attitude towards learning by being punctual and prepared for class, and then focused and active in class. The extent and impact of your out-of-class work.
-Your attendance of a library workshop and completion of a related online quiz.
-Throughout the semester

Vocabulary Tests Weeks  5 & 12 (in class)

The 120 assigned words are divided into 3 word lists.

Test 1 (5%)

The 40 words in Vocabulary List 1 will be tested.
There are 20 fill-in-the-blank sentences. The words will be provided for you. You have 15 minutes to complete the test. Your instructor will let you know whether the test will be given at the beginning or at the end of the lesson.

Test 2 (10%) –
All 120 assigned words will be tested.
There are 40 fill-in-the-blank sentences. The words will be provided for you. You have 30 minutes to complete the test. Your instructor will let you know whether the test will be given at the beginning or at the end of the lesson.

Important notes on the tests
You will take the test under exam conditions:  no notes, no dictionaries, no talking.
Each word can be used only once.
You may need to change the form of the word.
You will get no marks for the wrong spelling.
reviews.comment_workload:
In line with general University guidelines, the Center for Language Education’s official minimum attendance requirement for all LANG non-elective courses is 80% (inclusive of the Add/Drop period).

If you miss 6 or more classes, you will fail the course and will have to retake it the following year.

Standard Build of LANG1002:
1st Speaking Task 15%
A 2 1/2 – 3 minute speech to inspire possibility in younger students.

1st Writing Task 10%
A paragraph about an idea which changed people’s lives, in which you demonstrate your paragraph writing skills.

2nd Writing Task 30%
An expository essay, in which you introduce a past game-changing idea and explain its impact.

2nd Speaking Task 20%
A 3 1/2 to 4 minute talk about your past game changer.

Vocabulary Tests 15%
(two tests)
Evidence of knowing 120 set words, based on your ability to use them.

Participation 10% Throughout the semester
Your preparation for class and general effort to take part in classes and raise your proficiency.

reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor teaches concrete and useful things. She always told us her experience on learning and practicing English. She prepared before the tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading: Normal
reviews.comment_workload: Prepare the work for the next lesson if she told you to do so. Well prepared for assignments and quizzes. Remember to attend the library workshop and take the related quiz

reviews.author: Terrancexxx
reviews.comment_content: It's not only focused on the content written on the books but also some kinds of oral skills in practial English. And we can do a lot of interesting games together in groups and every time you attend you can always get something new!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructure is humorous and careful.and we can get a lot of knowledge in laughter!
reviews.comment_grading: the grade is quitely fair. and it is also about the performance on the facebook groups so it is quite interesting when you earning your grade. and the mid-term needs your own effort in this class. each points come from your own diligence!
reviews.comment_workload: you can do alot of things in english if you are intersted in it!

reviews.author: fhfui
reviews.title: Nice teacher w/ awesome pronunciation and enthusiasm
reviews.comment_content:
(Talking about course content, not teaching content)
Generally speaking the content is not so attractive. What we are going to learn in this course is academic writing and presentation skills. We are frequently taught "this and that because we are going to do our writing/speaking assignment/have an ELPA test". I don't understand why such profit-minded ideas are conveyed from the textbook. I don't consider it a wonderful approach to appeal students to learning English.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr. WONG has awesome pronunciation and tries hard to make the class vibrant. He has tried a lot of ways to encourages us to think, discuss and express our own thoughts. I can feel he is going all out to make this relatively dull class colorful.

Plus Mr Wong is a very kind instructor. He doesn't appear to be rigid or full of rules, and is always glad to answer our questions. He has managed to remember our names in a few classes' time, and take our attendance during video playback or article reading, making the most use of in-class time.
reviews.comment_grading: We haven't be graded yet, Just writing this comment after the first class so I can be recognized "having contributed to ust space" so as to use full features.
reviews.comment_workload: Mr Wong leaves us few out of class tasks apart from the compulsory writing and speaking assignments. He likes to "do as many things as we can in class", extracting the most informative and notable points from tons of canvas resources and textbook articles. What he leaves us after class, however, are mostly optional and external learning resources like websites and videos.

reviews.author: kiu01
reviews.comment_content: The course content is based on the book materials, and mainly focuses on the topic "game changers". Several assignments will be given related to this topic, including writing and speaking.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer is quite good and he will ask you to answer questions each lesson. It is not boring as some videos will be played related to the topic to enhance your understandings.

For some assignments or problems, he gives comprehensive advice to each person.
reviews.comment_grading:
Speaking (35%), Writing (40%), Vocabulary Test (15%), Participation (10%)

For the speaking, I just got the average score around 5 out of 7, writing 6-7 out of 7 and vocabulary test 27 out of 40. Final grade I had an A-

I think the grade he gave is quite good, at least no many mistakes he will give you a decent mark. Just refer to the descriptor to do your assignment and make sure you achieve the criteria that the course requires you to do so.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not really heavy, but you have to spend a few minutes to do homework after every lesson.

reviews.author: Tess
reviews.comment_content:
LANG1002 content

Video, essay of game changer, I forgot..
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ordinary teaching skills, the class was in death silence and you can always hear laughters from other classroom.

As a native speaker of English, she talks smoothly with good pronunciation, but quite slow that you can hear every single word clearly (not that good for those who want to practice their oral language and speak like a native speaker). Her tone was dry and not interesting :(

And she always forgot what she wass going to say, it made me think that she didn't prepare the lesson..
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was quite good. She is a good person still.

I submitted both assignment late (the video and the final essay) and I guess she was little angry. But the grades turned out were not that disappointing.

Skipped 2 or 3 lessons. Average score was 4.

Eventually she kicked me to 1003I class :((((( Maybe she just didn't like me.
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal workload.

Not much additional assignment to do except LANG1002 regular workload.

She would use last 30 minutes of the lesson to let us discuss about sth related to the topic/what we've learnt in the class. Quite relaxed.

reviews.author: Smallpenguin
reviews.comment_content: Tutor will teach you how to write an article and technique of speech. I think what you have learned is depended on your vocabulary,gramma(the level of your English). The content won't help you a lot in grading.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing new. Just same as the secondary school one and easy to feel bored in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: It is depended on your tutor. Most schoolmates got poor grade because of the killer.
reviews.comment_workload: It is also depended on your tutor . Some classes are more free that tutors won't give you so much exercises or check your answers in the book. However, this kinds of homework maybe good for you as it helps you to finish your writing exam and speech test step by step.

reviews.author: acatslave
reviews.comment_content: Content is based on book materials mainly about how to write an academic essay, which is quite useful as guidelines for freshmen to write assignments effectively.
reviews.comment_teaching: Highly recommend Angie, she is so nice! She's willing to give comments and suggestions after lessons and through email.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade is good. Even your first speaking assignment did not do well, you can still get a B+ if all sub scores in final essay is 5. But very few of us can get an A. As lonf as you fulfill all the requirements of speaking and writing assignment, it is not hard to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: As a S class student, workload is fair, homework is given for the preparation of the next lesson, which is reasonable.

reviews.author: Annabelle Ruby
reviews.title: Excellent instructor Linda
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very helpful especially some recommendation on the reference websites.

You may have to take notes if possible. And it will help you a lot!
reviews.comment_teaching: Linda is a very helpful instructor. She will help you individually on your task. For example, she will help you correct your mistakes and polish the essay. She will give you detailed advise on your video task. What impress me most is that she will reply your mail as soon as she can.
reviews.comment_grading: very fair!!
reviews.comment_workload:
All is the same in the Lang course.
No extra assignment!

reviews.author: a.stupid
reviews.title: Bad grade, good tutor
reviews.comment_content: The content is just basic academic writing stuff - feels like going back to secondary school english class. You can have the chance to know some people in class because the main task in class is to discuss with your groupmates in english.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is really good - not boring, and willing to answer students' questions. one of the best lang tutor i have ever met. He will talk a bit more about university life and how you get through these four years, and i don't think other tutors will tell you that.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say my english is above average as i got all 5* in HKDSE english language while only getting a 3 in writing paper. Maybe this is the reason why i get a B- from LP. He is indeed not a good grade tutor. but the emphasize on writing also contribute a lot to my bad grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that much, just write a few essays and record a video. But you have to pay attention to the essays you write as it weight a lot on your final grade.

mainly stick on the lang textbook

reviews.comment_content:
(唔知有咩好寫,照抄佢官網,可以無視)
-write in a coherent, well-organised way;
-speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts;

reviews.comment_teaching:
雖然grade真係唔靚

最後B

本身lang你可以話基本上冇workload

做嘅時候就算有咩問題都可以下一堂問

但其實如果係有心做你首先要搵篇有心睇
再要用時間睇

注意!!!!!!!!!!:
佢講到明佢99.99%教9點堂
各位fm如果見到自己lang係9點
請即卡轉(除非唔怕辛苦/爛grade,只係純粹想學野)

reviews.author: trollkwan
reviews.comment_content:
st Speaking Task

A 2½ – 3 minute speech to inspire possibility in younger students

15%

Week 6

Video to be uploaded to CANVAS



1st Writing Task



A paragraph about a past game-changing idea, in which you demonstrate your paragraph writing skills.

10%

Week 8

2nd Writing Task

An expository essay, in which you introduce a past game-changing idea and explain its impact. The essay must be submitted to Turnitin.

30%

Week 11

Final copy must be uploaded to Turnitin

2nd Speaking Task

A 3½ – 4 minute talk about your past game changer.

20%

Weeks 12 & 13

Vocabulary Learning



Evidence of learning 120 set words.



15%

Online learning throughout the semester + final test (Week 12)

Participation

The extent to which you demonstrate a mature and responsible attitude towards learning by being punctual and prepared for class, and then focused and active in class. The extent and impact of your out-of-class work.

+

Your attendance of a library workshop and completion of a related online quiz.

10%

Throughout the semester

reviews.title: average
reviews.comment_content: The course content is quite similar to the english lesson of normal hong kong sec school, talking about how to improve students' speaking, reading, writing and listening skills. 1002 stresses quite a lot in speaking.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The spoken english of Bruce is quite awful. Hardly in the earth can find a english tutor with very strong chinese accent like him.
Anyways, despite the poor accent, his lessons were quite useful and informative at all. He taught mainly the skills, proverb, slang, vocab, that you can use it in the day to day life.

reviews.author: VIRose
reviews.title: Try your best in 1002 and cross your fingers for 1003
reviews.comment_content: Just like all language lessons, following the syllabus. Since you can't choose whether you could take this course, just ignore this part LOL
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alex was friendly and would considerate students' opinion on workload or something else, you get it HAHA
However he may not be the instructor of LANG1002 this year, see if you are lucky to meet him.
Best of luck guys!
reviews.comment_grading:
I will say I could have got better grade if I have done better preparation. But the grade was already satisfying considering the effort I have put in. Alex is worth choosing if you could find him. For your reference, I went to every class and was active in class so I guess I got the full participation marks.
He did mentioned he rarely fail people but if you showed no effort he would.
Personal opinion would be do your best in 1002 because you have little control for 1003 as there is ELPA counted in the grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light, but requirements stated in the syllabus have to be done while they did't take much time to prepare: 3 vocabulary tests, very easy if you have studied beforehand, get at least 17 or 18 correct out of 20 questions for A range meanwhile15 to 17 out of 20 for B range ; 1 short essay; 1 long essay (actually it's not really long); 1 recorded speech (since it is recorded, you could do it repeatedly if you don't like it before the deadline); 1 live speech on class.
Sometimes there could be some homework but it doesn't hurt if you don't do it, it could actually help your English if you have finish them.

reviews.author: enelcnil
reviews.comment_content: LANG1002 is a three-credit core course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. Students attend three hours of class and complete up to six hours of out-of-class work per week. The course is offered in Fall semesters. This is an EAP course with a primary focus on language development and proficiency. The course also supports students with academic literacy skills. It aims at enhancing underlying competencies – e.g. Language form and accuracy in spoken and written contexts; Language meaning and use; Self-directed lifelong learning that are necessary for students to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.

Grade: B

Writings are graded with "feeling" so you cannot do much to change your marks but it's normal.
In my class participation does not matter but I am not sure about others.

For reference:
HKDSE
Paper 1:5*
Paper 2:4
Paper 3:5
Paper 4:4
Overall:4

I am not elite in English so I can only say extra reading and exercise may help.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments before every lesson including multiple choices, short writing and reflection on materials such as videos and scripts.
Heavy but you can submit unlimited times and the scores do not matter as you will have full marks in self-directed learning once you finish all tasks on time.
Also 2 reflective diaries and a video+writing script
You don't need to revise if you have good English.

reviews.author: Puiii
reviews.title: Chan, Ka Long Roy
reviews.comment_content:
Don't think it's useful except the academic writing part.
Contents are boring but Roy still tried to make the lessons funny and interactive,
Besides, as we got a new syllabus this year, even professors didn't know much about the course and how to grade our assignments...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Roy is good so reg him! Roy's lessons are fun and he is always welcome to answer our questions after class.

He knows we want good grades so he tried hard to help us with our works. But it will definitely be better if u could make him recognise u for something good.
reviews.comment_grading:
The syllabus is just a mess cuz everything kept changing every lesson. But at last we completed:
- A "Reflective Diary" (~700 words for me)
- A "Talking-head Video" (max. 4 mins) with a 300-word "Written Summary"
- numerous "Self=directed Learning Coursework"(SDL) (Don't miss them if u want a good grade!)
- one group discussion (I really don't know what was I talking about though I was above mean)

My results:
- 4/5 for all assignments except SDL
- full mark for SDL
- final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy but trivial (especially for those SDL items cuz u will lose marks whenever u forgot to do the small quizzes before deadlines)

For deadline fighters like me, time is tight for finishing the video and the summary cuz it was due just before final exams...

Not much preparation is required before lessons (I skipped most of the pre-lesson materials and just 吹水 whenever Roy asked me to share)

reviews.author: jerry wang
reviews.comment_content:
There are 3 units(necessary) and 4 electives(choose 2). The content, in my opinion, is only a bit useful. Don't expect to improve your english a lot by just taking this class.
Attendance will be taken but will not affect the final grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr John is really a good teacher. In each class he will put all the students into different groups randomly, and when discussing, he will play background music to make us ease. He is also willing to answer my questions, and can even point out where you should improve in homework. He replies emails really fast, within 30 minutes.
reviews.comment_grading:
I finish all the tasks in time and attended all the classes. I got the average of 3.5-4 of 5 and finally I got A-, which I was really surprised.
Speak often in class, ask questions and send emails, let professor see your efforts, I think you will get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy at all, if you make efforts daily. Before classes preparations are required, around 10-30 minutes. The electives are just around 1-2 hours, and just 2 are required during the  semester. For the big homework, you will have at least 10 days to prepare, some are even 1 months, so you don't need to worry about.

reviews.author: Krystall
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1: developing skills for self-directed learning and language building
Unit 2 - developing language and literacy skills to help build effective arguments
Unit 3 - developing language and literacy skills to help communicate effective arguments for the audience and purpose
Elective 1 Improving pronunciation
Elective 2 Expanding vocabulary
Elective 3 Research and referencing skills
Elective 4 Developing confidence in speaking at university
reviews.comment_teaching:
Online
He is a nice teacher
for assignments, follow his steps will be alright, mark-oriented teaching, great for me
reviews.comment_grading: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
for every assignment, he will have his small tasks for us before, group tasks

light for online
heavy for face-to-face

reviews.author: SmokingPuddle58
reviews.title: Grade in DSE doesn't matter!
reviews.comment_content:
Hmm... Content?

What can you expect to learn from a LANG course that is one of the graduation requirement? But it's a good course for you to make friends.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Super good!

Professor Ivan prepares his PowerPoint and movies for some lessons, though he still follows the note prepared by CLE for every lessons. He's very funny and I never feel bored in his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
SDL:                      15%
Group discussion:  20%
Reflective diary:     25%
PAPA:                     40%

Me:
SDL : 7/7 3/3
Group discussion: 3.5 3
PAPA: 3 3 3.5(If I remember)
Reflective diary: I cannot get them as they got disappeared on CLE feedback website. But the scores were around 3-3.5.

Final grade: B

It turns out that the grade in DSE isn't quite related to the grade you get in LANG1002S. I got level 3 in English(Sub-grades: 3344) but got B in this course(Maybe still not good enough but it's enough for me)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not heavy except for PAPA and 2 electives. You only need to complete some tasks before next lesson, and only those with SDL will be graded but still, you are suggested to complete all of them because lessons will be based on these tasks. For electives, you have to finish 1 each before midterm and final and I can't figure out how useful they are(Maybe they taught me how to Google🤔 ,but I know how to use that!)

reviews.author: Kaisa
reviews.title: Interesting Prof and interesting lecture
reviews.comment_content: 60% of lang 1002s content is common sense or what you have learned in middle school, but the rest is very helpful. Electives are great, although there can be boring parts and some meaningless questions like "Which part do you like best and why "hahhh
reviews.comment_teaching: Po Lung is the best prof I met in this semester. Kind, considerate, warmhearted and devoted. He tried his best to make the course interesting and help students involved in. He also share inspiring videos to help us understand knowledge and learn about some lessons. He never strictly criticize anyone and when you do someting not good he just point out in a kind way. He shares chocolate with us and is like our grandpa hahhhh. He is so cute.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair and so satisfactory.
Actively involve in class and think about questions. What is more, get prepared for discussion. Do not miss classes since we take attendance frequently.
Finally A-,reaaaally surprised and happy. I did not expect an A range in lang course because everyone said lang course=爛龜
reviews.comment_workload: Really tight. SDL is easy and not time consuming. Reflective diary and recording are also not as difficut as imagined. No homework, only preparation before classes.

reviews.author: ychingc
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1: developing skills for self-directed learning and language building
Unit 2 - developing language and literacy skills to help build effective arguments
Unit 3 - developing language and literacy skills to help communicate effective arguments for the audience and purpose
Elective 1 Improving pronunciation
Elective 2 Expanding vocabulary
Elective 3 Research and referencing skills
Elective 4 Developing confidence in speaking at university
finish 2 electives are ok
reviews.comment_teaching: He explained the assignment detail very clearly and got a good accent and clear pronunciation. 2 consulting sessions were held before the assignment due date. Very nice and good grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Self-directed learning 15%
Discussion skills 20%
Reflective diary 25%
Presenting alternative perspectives assessment 40%
Self-directed learning: 10/10 (electives and attendance)
Discussion skills: 7/10 (group discussion)
Reflective diary: 5/5 (600 words essay)
Presenting alternative perspectives assessment:
5/5, 3/5, 3/5 total: 11/15 (speech video)
I got B+, very sad, don't edit the video of the last assignment.
reviews.comment_workload: Not that high. The tutor provided a lot of supplies. Just finish the 2 electives on time and don't skip the class. Speak more in class. Hope to have a good groupmate in group discussion and use more difficult words. ASK MORE IN CONSULTATION TO AVOID STUPID MISTAKES!!!

reviews.author: lancelot
reviews.title: Great teacher
reviews.comment_content:
cover reading + writing + speaking + research skills

the speaking and research skills part are most useful, I would like to have a full course just for the speaking part.

social media is the main topic this year, easily related to some of the hottest news. content from the course or class discussion are informative.
reviews.comment_teaching:
You must choose Rebecca as your course instructor if you can. She is so nice and enthusiastic. In the lecture, she always ask questions and let us discuss. It keeps me pay attention and think a lot on the questions. Approximately ~50% or more time, we are talking or discussing with classmates on the issues of that day.

I asked other Year 1 students and they said most of the time in their lecture is just listening and reading power points. I think this is so boring and almost nothing can be learned.

Also,  it is really suprising that Rebecca will write a lot of useful recommendation in the feedback after grading your assessment. I think it is almost 5-10 times longer when I compared with my friend 's feedback who study in other class.


Just try to swap to Rebecca's course if you can!
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it is quite fair but it depends on your classmates.

The members of your group discussion are VERY important.
DON'T SPEAK TOO LONG!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is okay. But you should do the writing and video as soon as possible, I have 3-4 assignment to hand in in the last few days of study so I don't have much time to finish each of them. I think I can do a lot better if I start them one week before.


The most difficult part for me is the last assessment, we have to record a 4 min video for a social issue. I use too much time to decide the topic and to find the arguments and examples. But actually you should put most of the time on adjusting your speaking tone, volume, pitch or body language.

reviews.author: Joannew
reviews.comment_content:
總括而言，當自己是在上中學那樣。有各種小練習要在課内/課後去做，主要是有關寫作和口語。

一開始是介紹課程資料，然後是各種大學裏理論上會有用的英文理論知識。比如Critical thinking， Research and referencing skills
reviews.comment_teaching: 她是個很溫柔的導師，會一直鼓勵我們。
reviews.comment_grading: 只要交齊所有功課，加上兩份assignment不過不失，會有B range。（For Shen Chi）如果有關其他Instructor，請參考其他評論。
reviews.comment_workload: 每一堂都會有SDL，可能係MC，答問題，做工作紙，和兩份自選SDL（四選一）。不過其實只要有做就可以。如果你不是deadline fighter，兩份Essay的workload不算特別大。

reviews.author: Vincentchan9839
reviews.title: Mr Tang is a great tutor! :)
reviews.comment_content:
There are three units in this course:

Unit 1: developing skills for self-directed learning and language building

Unit 1 Lesson 1 Course introduction
Unit 1 Lesson 2 Responsible language learning
Unit 1 Lesson 3 Reflective learning
Unit 1 Lesson 4 Social learning
Unit 1 Lesson 5 Using appropriate language style

Unit 2: developing language and literacy skills to help build effective arguments

Unit 2 Lesson 1 Developing a critical mind
Unit 2 Lesson 2 Discussing alternative perspectives (1) * attend 40 min only
Unit 2 Lesson 3 Discussing alternative perspectives (2) *attend 40 min only
Unit 2 Lesson 4 Critical reading
Unit 2 Lesson 5 Developing a strong argument
Unit 2 Lesson 6 Finding and evaluating sources
Unit 2 Lesson 7 Arguing from multiple perspectives

Unit 3: developing language and literacy skills to help communicate effective arguments for the audience and purpose

Unit 3 Lesson 1 Preparing a video for your audience
Unit 3 Lesson 2 Producing coherent texts
Unit 3 Lesson 3 Paraphrasing and summarizing
Unit 3 Lesson 4 Engaging an audience in your ideas
Unit 3 Lesson 5 Producing a persuasive argument
Unit 3 Lesson 6 Using language to engage and help the audience follow
Unit 3 Lesson 7 Using voice to engage
Unit 3 Lesson 8 Developing natural and confident speech

In addition to the above things, there are also 4 things you need to do:
-Self directed learning
-Discussion skills
-Reflective diary
-Presenting alternative perspectives assessment (PAPA)

As you can see, this course involves many things to do. However, I think I cannot learn much in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Tang is a nice and interesting guy! He is very kind that he told us we can just call him Kin. I really enjoy his teaching style and his British accent (He has lived in the UK for about 20 years before returning to HK if I remember that correct).

Every time you step into classroom, he always arrange the seats in a U shape arrangement as he always require us to talk to each other in pair during the class for discussion. I love to talk to my classmates very much as this helps to make the atmosphere more relaxing.

He also answers my questions clearly. He is a really helpful tutor.

He is one of the best English language tutor I have ever seen! Please enroll his section if the system pre-register a "killer" for you!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is nice!

Even though Mr Tang said that he described himself as a fair person, I think he is better than a fair person and he should be described as a good person in giving us the grades.

Here is the grading policy:
Self directed learning (15% of course grade)
Discussion skills (20% of course grade)
Reflective diary (25% of course grade)
Presenting alternative perspectives assessment (PAPA) (40% of course grade)

My result:

Self directed learning: 10/10

Discussion skills:
Interaction: 3.5/5
Spoken Language: 3/5

Reflective diary:
Written Language: 3.5/5

PAPA:
Written Language: 3.5/5
Spoken Language: 3.5/5
Coherence: 4/5

Grade: B+

For your reference, here are my 2021 HKDSE English Language result:

Paper 1 Reading: Level 4
Paper 2 Writing: Level 5
Paper 3 Listening and Integrated Tasks: Level 4
Paper 4 Speaking (School-based assessment, SBA): Level 4

Overall: Level 4

You may notice even though my English Language result in the public exam is mediocre, the grade I get in LANG1002S can still be a little bit surprising. Therefore, please work hard to get a better result.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, I do not like language subject very much when I was studying secondary school. But when you compared the workload of this course to that in secondary school, the burden of LANG1002S is still definitely more lighter.

The before class preparation is the most annoying thing to do in this course. You need to do all of them if you want to get good grade. Sometimes the preparation can be time-consuming, but it can also be done in under 20 minutes.

Plus, the diary, the assessed discussion and the PAPA are also the major workload in this course. Please make sure that you are well-prepared before doing them. Otherwise, you will get low marks.

reviews.author: Aud

reviews.comment_content: Well, contents are prepared by the language centre so instructors have no choice to choose using what materials.

Roy is new to UST and I will say he is 100% not a killer. He gave me an A in this course (precondition: submit all the work on time!)
He gave an A- to my friend too (which is unexpected coz she is not outstanding in the course(my friend said it, not me!) )
reviews.comment_workload:

NO extra work if the department doesn't require xd

Discussion

Remember don't skip class!! Parti is counted.

reviews.author: 科大公道伯
reviews.title: Rosie世一 真係好有heart!!!!!好用心!!!!! 想學英文請揀佢
reviews.comment_content: 唔重要 反正其他人會講

reviews.author: etufo312
reviews.title: NICE PROF!!!!
reviews.comment_content: It divide into two part with different topics. Should vary a little every sem, so I don't know what topic you will have. But they are usually not that hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Love this professor. He is very passionate on his teaching and try very hard to lift up the learning atmosphere by asking and chatting during the class. Though he would not force you to answer him if you don't want to. But his attitude would at least make you want to try.
reviews.comment_grading:
A-

To be honest, I am surprise that I got this grade, as I am not very good at English. I suppose it really depends on what professor you get.
reviews.comment_workload: Average workload, two speaking and one essay. should be pretty manageable after your torture in the HKDSE period. The essay is around 800-1000 with a topic of your choice, relatively easy compared to other course.

reviews.author: ghjkll
reviews.title: I love Shaun!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content: I put an "A" is not because the content of the course is that good. It is because Shaun is really fun and interesting, he made the boring content sounds interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Shaun is really a good instructor. He is patient and kind. Unlike other lang instructors, he really cares about the learning outcome of his student.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average = 5 then secure B+ or above.
I will say Shaun's grading is understandable. His comment is really critical and reasonable. In Chinglish, You won't don't know why you die.

For the grading blocks, I just skip it here, other reviews have already clearly stated.
reviews.comment_workload: Though Shaun is really good. The workload of the course is standardized. Thus, the workload is kind of same with other instructors.

reviews.author: Pearlmilktea
reviews.title: Unexpected good grade course, I love Eunice!!!
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly focused on teaching you the basic concept and writing style of academic writing like using citation and learning different types of genres which I think were already been taught in secondary school. So it is just like an advanced writing skill course to teach you what you can do better and how to write in a formal style. The ppts were prepared by the instructors I think. Sometimes, she will refer to the textbook content, I think the instructors were required to do so.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eunice is a very good, caring and patient teacher.
During the online mode teaching, except for the course required assignments, she rarely assigned us homework and readings before class as she said that she knew we are busy studying other courses and she tried her best to minimize our workload, so we could feel more relax and focus more in class.
She always showed her understanding and give brief feedback after we shared our ideas or after a small group presentation. Also, she is so so so patient and kind toward the students, she never forced us to turn on our cameras and she never blames us for our low participation during class.  I love her so much.
reviews.comment_grading:
Speaking 1: 33 (full mark: 44, but I am not a fluent English speaker.)
Writing: 554 (full: 777, as I had more time to prepare this assignment a few months before the deadline.)
Speaking 2: 554 (full: 777, the preparation time was enough and Eunice gave us a chance to practice in class with our classmates to prepare ourselves before the real exam.)
Final grade: A- (I love Eunice)
reviews.comment_workload: As I mentioned, she did not give us much homework or readings, so we could have more time to spend on preparing our course required assignments like the speaking and the writing tasks.

reviews.author: Perper
reviews.title: Hardworking is required, not getting expected result
reviews.comment_content:
1.) He provided a lot of instructions about your assignment.
2.) At the very beginning lesson, he gave us half-hour to make friends with others.

4.) Attendance is required.
reviews.comment_teaching:

Good accent and you can feel his passion for teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.comment_workload:
It depends on how you think.
I think it is a bit heavy.

There will be 3 vocabulary lists in total, which require definition, synonyms, example sentences, and your own sentence. Everyone no matter in which lang course needs to do it.
Each vocabulary list requires around 2-3 weekdays to do it if you are doing it seriously.

Also, you need to hand in one essay for the course, and the essay requires a brief plan and a detailed plan. But those can be done easily.
(Friendly reminder, do the essay plan seriously, it helps when it comes to completing the essay.)

Also, there will be speaking tasks, presentations, etc. Everything in the course count marks as there is no midterm and final.

The workload is a bit heavy, especially for freshmen. However, you will be used to it after the first semester and the second semester will be a bit lighter.

*By comparing the workload of lang course and the others, the workload here is definitely a lot higher. Time management is really really important! As here is one course's workload only, don't be a deadline fighter XDXD.

reviews.author: nobodyhaha
reviews.comment_content:
LANG1002 is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to raise your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence - e.g. thinking critically, discussing and presenting ideas logically - necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.

On this course you will develop your ability to use English to communicate appropriately and effectively. The thematic focus of the course provides context for tasks, most of which require small group collaboration and discussion. They are central to the course methodology. The course materials have been designed to present you with in-class challenges to your present language proficiency and communication skills, and the course assessment will help you to develop these further.

Both research and experience have indicated that the major academic language needs of students are in the areas of writing, speaking, vocabulary and extensive reading. The specific emphasis of LANG1002 is, therefore, on increasing your ability to:

write in a coherent, well-organised way;
speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts;
use a range of complex language, where appropriate to the task;
extract key information quickly from written texts;
take charge of your own language learning, particularly with respect to increasing your vocabulary.
reviews.comment_teaching: okay, little bit boring
reviews.comment_grading: fair
reviews.comment_workload: 1 essay, 1 writing, 3 voc list

reviews.author: 麻糬炸雞

first speaking task: 3/2
first speaking reflection: yes
writing task (game changer essay): 4/4/5/0
***for reference: I got 7/6/6/5/0 in essay from LANG1003S
essay process:4
second speaking task: 4/4/4
vocab learning record: 3
finally C+ (fuckkkkkkkk)

My English level didn't (and couldn't) change so much throughout this year. But I got almost all scores 5-6 in LANG1003S in 2020-2021 spring with a different tutor. So you can see how BAD she gives marks.

reviews.author: 落車請早揚聲
reviews.title: An unexpected good grade
reviews.comment_content:
English language. Noting much I think.

including words, speech, essay, etc. Standard content of a lang course.
reviews.comment_teaching: John likes to put us into break out rooms and let us do self discussing(using oral english). He also kind of likes to stick to the ppt during the lecture, yet the content is not too boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Everyone keeps saying CLE is killier for grading. But I really don't think so. The grading of Lang really depends on how your instructor sees you effort. For John, he likes to ask students to be co-host during the class, DO IT! it makes him see your will and effort in practicing oral English.  And as for the essay and speech, you really should start way before ddl, not starting the day before due. When you prepare for it, you can ask questions to let the instructor see your effort. To be honest, I really think I prepared a lot for the sppech and essay.

(eventually all 6/7 for speech and essay and full marks for everything else, ended up with A+)

So make sure your instructor sees your effort, make him remember you. Because comparing to other courses, Lang really depends on the impression you left to the instructor. So it's really important to leave a good impression.
reviews.comment_workload: Well this is a lang course, so dont expect the workload to be small. There are many assesd assignments throughout the semester and you are gonna be like dealing one after another dues.
