reviews.author: O'Neal
reviews.comment_content:
Vocabulary

Understand and use a range of vocabulary and expressions that are commonly used in general English and in academic discussions.
Critical thinking and reading skills

Select, read and evaluate a variety of texts, including scholarly writing, to develop understanding of a complex topic.
Select appropriate information for a specific audience and purpose.
Distinguish key points from details in order to summarise information for a specific audience and purpose.
Writing skills

Plan, research and structure a piece of writing according to the needs of a specific reader and purpose.
Write a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs, in which topic sentences containing controlling ideas are expanded with details, examples and explanations.
Write a short, expository essay, using explanation, justification, description, and analysis.
Paraphrase sentences from sources to support ideas and claims; and appropriately acknowledge the sources.
Speaking skills

Speak about a topic for at least two minutes.
Make an oral summary.
Deliver a speech, inspiring possibility.
Deliver a documentary-style talk, using explanation and analysis to arouse the interest of your audience.
Pronounce sounds clearly and use rhythm appropriately
Competency- building
Collaborate with others in discussions to achieve specific outcomes.
Leadership and teamwork

Demonstrate understanding of the impact of an idea on lives.
International outlook

Demonstrate the ability to use appropriate strategies, tools and resources to develop language proficiency and academic literacy.
reviews.comment_teaching: teaching is good and she may ask you questions during lessons. There will be some group discussion in the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
the grade of this course is acceptable.
i got B+.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is not really heavy. 2 vocab test, 2 speaking tasks. Don't really need to pay so much effort.

reviews.author: SA_1007
reviews.title: A teacher you need if you want to learn more ^o^
reviews.comment_content:
This course was relatively easy in my opinion since it aims to equip students with necessary English-related skills required for handling genera university assignments. Basics skills like reading, writing and speaking, not too much on listening, was included. For reading, in class mostly the required textbook has sufficient reading for students to do both in class and as homework.

Assignment: 2 speaking, 2 writing

1) video recording about giving an inspirational speech to your junior secondary schoolmate.

Writing task (broken down into 2 parts, but both are a part of the same essay)
2)  1st writing task - writing the introduction paragraph of the essay with the topic of GAME CHANGER

3) 2nd writing task - Complete essay on game changer (600 - 800 words)

4) 3-4 mins presentation about what you think is a game changer

5) 2 vocab test

[I apologize for not remembering the percentage :( ]
reviews.comment_teaching:
She follows the class schedule very well and very easy to follow. Not too strict, not too lenient.

Gives clear guidance on the assignment as I noticed many students had trouble handling the assignments. Very helpful as well. So don't be afraid to go up to her, especially after lesson. She also accepts question during class.

For the 1st speaking last and the 1st writing task, she will use one lesson each to provide feedback and comments as well as advices to help you improve on the following 2nd speaking and2nd writing task.

During class, she made do several group discussion which was a great opportunity for student to have the time to speak English. Also we would to do mini writings with our group mates.
All in all, I think her lesson is fun actually not that boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each assignment has has different area of marking with each 7 points as max

My grades went something like this

1st speaking : 6 6
1st writing: 5 5
2nd writing: 6 6
2nd speaking: 6 6
I don't remember my scores for vocab tests but it was about 60%.

Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Should be okay. Only four assignments. Probably the preparation work for the writing task is more than the speaking. You need to find enough sources for support you writing.

But great preparation is highly recommended for speaking if you want to ace your speaking assignment.

reviews.author: OsmondL
reviews.comment_content: Mainly read out the content from the textbook so don't expect you can get some special skills from her.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is good, but if you are a bit aggressive, her teaching style may be too slow to you. Also, she is nice and willing to have some chitchat with you.
reviews.comment_grading: I am not really good at English but her grading is quite good, at least i got an A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Zero workload!!!! No extra assignment, only some in class assignment and those which are required by HKUST. Two speaking tasks, two writing tasks and 3 vocab test only.

reviews.author: Nicole MA
reviews.comment_content: Just regular stuff of English learning with nothing special. She mostly stuck with the textbook, which is fine but a little boring. Overall this class has provided some technique in writing essays and presentation skills.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kathy is a very nice person. She is happy to answer some questions and she puts aside the first five minutes of class in case anyone arrived late.
Two of our classes were in computer room, and once nearly everyone forgot to go there, so she came to fetch us from the regular classroom.
Kathy speaks clearly and is very easy to understand.Sometimes she specify someone to answer her question but it doesn't happen very often.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade was a huge surprise. I was constantly told that LANG1002S equals bad grade, but I managed to get an A-
There are two speaking assessments and two writing.
My first writing was 3 4 which is pretty bad.
The average of the rest is about 5.5
vocab tests were pretty difficult, I got 16/20 and 31/40 I would recommend doing all the VOLT and recite as many deformation as possible.
If you want a good grade, Kathy is an excellent choice that you won't regret!
reviews.comment_workload: Overall it does not demand a lot of time, but you should pay some attention to the assignments that you are weak at.

reviews.author: ANormalPerson
reviews.comment_content:
Basic English Grammar, criteria of academic writings, and "Game Changer".

A lot of video clips were shown, including those in TED talks with not-so-good English on purpose. They are mostly motivational speeches which are also interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sue is friendly and eager to teach, but she is just up to proficient in English.

She is lenient sometimes and able to understand the difficulty of students. I was once sick and slept in the class but she just let me do it. I was legit surprised because I except the tutor to be harsh on students.

However, I could spot some minor mistakes in her English pronunciation (or some non-British or non-American pronunciations). For example, sometimes she could not pronounce the "v" sound well and triggered me (in my brain only for sure lol).
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A- with the following marks:

1st Speaking: 4/7; 5/7
2nd Speaking: 4/7; 5/7; 5/7
1st Writing: 4/7; 4/7
2nd Writing: 4/7; 5/7; 5/7; 1/1
1st Vocab: 17.5/20
2nd Vocab: 32/40
Participation: 4/4
Library workshop attended.

I would say the marks are not that high, and I expected a grade of B- according to experiences of senior students that I know. However, it turned out to be in A range, which shocked me a bit.
I would say my GPA was saved by LANG1002S.
In fact, the grade this year seems to be more lenient. I am not sure what would the system be in the next year (2018-19).

And note that not attending the class for more than 3 times would get you a warning, which probably lowers your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate.
Two speaking assessments and two writing assessments, along with two vocabulary tests.

You do have to spend some time to prepare for speak assessments and writing assessments because they affect your grade for a lot. I didn't prepare well so it turned out that the performance wasn't very good or it may be possible for me to get more than A-.

For vocabulary tests, it is less demanding. The first test is easy because it only contains 20 words. The second test is even easier because you just have to understand each word and they will be provided in the test, which I knew most of them so I don't have to prepare for a lot. So if you have good vocabulary base then vocab test should be a piece of cake for you.

reviews.author: mhcm138
reviews.title: GOOD TUTOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content: Unit 1 is about people, passion and possibilities. Unit 2 is about Game changers. The lessons are based on the textbook. It will provide you some instructions, vocabs and sentence structure for academic writing and how to deliver a speech for academic purposes.

reviews.comment_grading:
1st Speaking Task (15%): 4 5
A 2½ – 3 minute speech to inspire possibility in younger students

1st Writing Task (10%): 5 6
A paragraph about a past game-changing idea, in which you demonstrate your paragraph writing skills.

2nd Writing Task (30%): 5 5 5 0
An expository essay, in which you introduce a past game-changing idea and explain its impact. The essay must be submitted to Turnitin.

2nd Speaking Task (20%): 5 5 6
A 3½ – 4 minute talk about your past game changer.

Vocabulary Learning(15%) VERY IMPORTANT, TRY TO GET AS MUCH AS YOU CAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Test 1: 18/20
Test 2: 34/40

Participation: 4/4

Final Grade: A (seems the grade depended on your own class)
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. But it is harsh before the deadline of the writing and speaking assignment. You definitely need some time to rehearse and proofread your assignments.

reviews.author: matt147

reviews.comment_content: LANG1002 is a three-credit core course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. reviews.author: PeaceWalker
reviews.title: Subjective grading with little concrete content delivered
reviews.comment_content:
Below is the syllabus of LANG 1002S.
Unit1 developing skills for self-directed learning and language building;
Unit2 developing language and literacy skills to help build effective arguments; and
Unit3 developing language and literacy skills to help communicate effective arguments for the audience and purpose.
The content, at first glance, seems helpful to paving the way for university studies. However, people in CLE are very good at giving you a promising overview/overall structure of the course, but then provide little to no solid instructions, advices, etc. that actually serve the purposes they've claimed. The student notes posted on Canvas aren't that conducive as well. Just for a brief example, in U2L1 notes, they listed expressions such as "I think" ,"I guess" and "In my opinion" and consider them "useful phrases" to be used in discussions. These ARE indeed usual expressions in colloquial conversations, but why bother listing these phrases that's familiar to almost everyone and call them "useful" ones? It gives me the feeling that they just don't feel like actually teaching students substatial communication skills, and payed nothing more than perfuctory efforts in making notes and slides.
reviews.comment_teaching:
My instructor is CHAN, Ka Long Roy.
He is kind enough to offer students help, and will reaily answer students' questions both via email and in person. Regarding the course subjects, I can tell that he had his personal insights, it's just the boring slides and barely usable notes that constraints his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is, without exaggerating, arbitrary, in the sense of a subjective marking scheme and the fact that they'd distribute letter grade with a fixed proportion, rather than referring to absolute grade.
Self directed learning - 15%
Discussion skills - 20%
Reflective diary - 25%
Presenting alternative perspectives assessment - 40%
As you can see, since there's no exams or dictations, your grades relies solely on the judement of your instructor, which may well be subjective, if not biased. The curving scheme also adds up to the uncertainty, granting some 3 A ranges(usually A-) and dozens of Bs and Cs in a Tutorial section.
So the bottomline here is: a) go take your TOEFL or IELTS and have the 3 credit transferred; b) if a) fails, try as best as you can to ingratiate yourself with the instructor, so that you may leave a good impression on him/her and earn a passing grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is pretty huge, since the before-class online assignments(the SDLs) are required, which are, again, boring and time-consuming. Other assignments and projects, such as the PAPA, also takes up tons of time and efforts.
Overall, I'm totally disappointed that the course failed to reach both students and the coordinator's expectations, and sincerely look forward to some changes(though not likely) in the preparing, teaching, and grading scheme of LANG1002S.

reviews.author: Arandomperson
reviews.title: God tutor good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Course Description
LANG1002S is a task-based, integrated-skills, English language course developed for first year students. It is the first of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to raise your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence – e.g. thinking critically, discussing and presenting ideas logically – necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.

In this course you will develop your ability to use English to communicate appropriately and effectively. The thematic focus of the course provides context for tasks, most of which require small group collaboration and discussion. They are central to the course methodology. The course materials have been designed to present you with in-class challenges to your present language proficiency and communication skills, and the course project will help you to develop these further.

Both research and experience have indicated that the major academic language needs of students are in the areas of writing, speaking, vocabulary and extensive reading. The specific emphasis of LANG1002S is, therefore, on increasing your ability to:

write in a coherent, well-organised way;
speak fluently, clearly, and effectively in a variety of contexts;
use a range of complex language, where appropriate to the task;
extract key information quickly from written texts;
take charge of your own language learning, particularly with respect to increasing your vocabulary.
The course is graded and carries three credits.

Important note:

Students will be pre-registered into LANG1002A / LANG1002S / LANG1002I based on their English proficiency upon admission to HKUST. This is the course which students must take in order to complete their graduation requirements. Putting students of a similar proficiency level in the same class makes it possible for teachers to focus lessons better and help students achieve targets set for the end of their Year One studies. Students who would like to know more about placement in a LANG 1002 class should contact Dr. Li Po Lung (E-mail: lcstdadvice@ust.hk).

Intended learning outcomes
Intended Learning Outcomes

Graduate attributes: By the end of this semester, students will be able to…

Vocabulary

Understand and use a range of vocabulary and expressions that are commonly used in general English and in academic discussions.
Critical thinking and reading skills

Select, read and evaluate a variety of texts, including scholarly writing, to develop understanding of a complex topic.
Select appropriate information for a specific audience and purpose.
Distinguish key points from details in order to summarise information for a specific audience and purpose.
Writing skills

Plan, research and structure a piece of writing according to the needs of a specific reader and purpose.
Write a series of coherent and cohesive paragraphs, in which topic sentences containing controlling ideas are expanded with details, examples and explanations.
Write a short, expository essay, using explanation, justification, description, and analysis.
Paraphrase sentences from sources to support ideas and claims; and appropriately acknowledge the sources.
Speaking skills

Speak about a topic for at least two minutes.
Make an oral summary.
Deliver a speech-with-a-story, sharing thoughts and giving advice.
Deliver a speech using speculation, explanation, and analysis.
Pronounce sounds clearly and use rhythm appropriately and persuasively.
Competency- building

Collaborate with others in discussions to achieve specific outcomes.
Leadership and teamwork

Demonstrate understanding of the impact of an idea on lives.
International outlook

Demonstrate the ability to use appropriate strategies, tools and resources to develop language proficiency and academic literacy.
Vision and orientation to the future

reviews.author: Jelly
reviews.title: mainly based on your own English ability
reviews.comment_content: The content is just same as other tutors, nothing special
reviews.comment_teaching:
Anna is an interactive and friendly teacher. She tried to put students into different groups for group discussion and class assignments, she would also help to check our essays before we submit to her officially.
If you don't have a good English background before entering University, she would offer extra practice to you before speaking assessments.
reviews.comment_grading:
For this semester, if you got an average sub-grading of 5/7 then you would get into A range and be promoted to A class next semester.
In this class, I saw some of my classmate having 3-4/7 per sub-grading for assignments but some of us are able to get up to 6-7/7. So please judge the grading yourself, here I provide my own grading for your reference.

Overall: A
1st Speaking Assessment: 7 7
1st Writing Assessment: 7 7
2nd Writing Assessment: 7 7 6 (0)
2nd Speaking Assessment: 5 5 5
Class Participation: 3
reviews.comment_workload: Anna has a slightly larger workload when comparing to other tutors because she likes to offer extra class assignments or homework before handing in the assignment for grading but you did get better grades for it.
